data.summary: Narrative review of heavy menstrual bleeding and iron-deficiency anemia in physically active women, proposing integrated screening and management pathway combining routine assessment, laboratory monitoring, nutrition intervention, and timely clinical referral.

data.title: Spatial Recurrence Is More Common Than Local Recurrence in Youth Athletes With Groin, Anterior Knee, and Heel Pain: A Retrospective Observational Study
data.sub_theme: recurrence patterns in youth athletes
data.summary: A retrospective study of 769 clinical episodes in youth athletes found that spatial recurrence (pain transitioning to adjacent body sites) was more common (9.5%) than local recurrence (7.4%) for groin, knee, and heel pain, suggesting whole-body functional assessment is needed for injury prevention.

data.title: Evaluating models of athlete development through assessment of within- and between-sport and activity variability among competitive female youth soccer athletes
data.sub_theme: early sport specialization versus diversification and skill development pathways
data.summary: Survey of 211 female competitive youth soccer athletes (aged 12-19) found higher skill groups participated in more childhood soccer practice and showed less sport diversity but greater team and position diversity, with soccer play hours positively correlated with soccer motivation, supporting early primary-sport engagement models.

data.title: The Relationship of Ankle Range of Motion and Jump and Agility in Adolescent Basketball Players

data.sub_theme: ankle range of motion and jump and agility performance
data.summary: Correlational study of 51 adolescent female basketball players found significant negative associations between frontal plane ankle range of motion (inversion, eversion) and jump/agility performance, with greater inversion ROM linked to lower countermovement jump performance (r=−0.343).

data.title: Sports Commitment and Phubbing: Reflections From Various Sports Disciplines

data.sub_theme: sports commitment and phubbing behavior

data.title: Load-Velocity Profiling in Female Traditional Rowers: Cross-Sectional Associations Between Prone Bench Pull and Half Squat with Rowing Performance

data.title: Factors Associated with Urinary Incontinence in Female Weightlifters

data.title: Convolutional Neural Networks for classifying galaxy mergers: Can faint tidal features aid in classifying mergers?
data.summary: Convolutional neural network applied to LSST-like deep astronomical images from Illustris TNG50 simulations achieves 67-70% accuracy in classifying galaxy mergers by detecting faint tidal features.

data.title: Age-Related Changes in Speech Recognition Performance-Intensity Functions and Auditory Brainstem Responses
data.summary: Prospective study comparing speech recognition and auditory brainstem responses between younger and older adults to investigate age-related cochlear synaptopathy and speech perception changes.

data.title: Follicular Helper T Cells and B Cell Maturation in Patients with 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome and Recurrent Infections
data.summary: Single-cell RNA-seq analysis reveals T cell senescence and altered gene expression patterns in patients with 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome, particularly in those with recurrent infections.

data.title: Symmetry-restoring finite counterterms of SMEFT four-fermion operator insertions at one loop
data.summary: Theoretical physics paper on renormalization of SMEFT four-fermion operators in quantum field theory using dimensional regularization.

data.title: Applying SEO Methods (On-Page and Off-Page) to Optimize the Ranking of the Top Herbal Atsiri Website
data.summary: Web optimization study applying on-page and off-page SEO methods to improve search engine ranking for a herbal health product website.

data.title: Asymptotic Behavior of Integral Projection Models via Genealogical Quantities
data.summary: Mathematical framework for analyzing asymptotic behavior of integral projection models and multi-state population models using genealogical quantities.

data.title: A model for applying corporate sustainability-related concepts to higher education
data.journal: International Journal of Sustainability in Higher Education
data.summary: Literature review proposing a model for applying corporate sustainability concepts to higher education institutions through triple bottom line plus governance framework.

data.title: A neural network solution for comprehensive contact analysis in hard-on-hard hip implants
data.sub_theme: hip implant contact mechanics
data.summary: A neural network model predicts contact conditions in hard-on-hard hip implants with equivalent accuracy to finite element methods but lower computational cost, identifying cup thickness as a key design factor.

data.title: Noam Chomsky and the End of Counterculture: Performing Dissent and 'Sunsteinization'
data.sub_theme: media criticism, intellectual dissent
data.summary: An analytical case study examining how intellectual dissent, exemplified by Noam Chomsky, is reconfigured into performative visibility within platform capitalism rather than oppositional critique.

data.title: Developing a Health-Oriented Assessment Framework for Office Interior Renovation: Addressing Gaps in Green Building Certification Systems
data.sub_theme: office interior renovation assessment
data.summary: A health-oriented assessment framework for office interior renovation is developed using Fuzzy Delphi and Analytic Hierarchy Process methods, identifying indoor air quality and HVAC efficiency as top priorities.

data.title: Indización de las revistas, boletines, cuadernillos y fanzines afroargentinos (1884-2009)
data.sub_theme: Afro-Argentine periodical publications
data.summary: An indexing study of Afro-Argentine periodicals (1884–2009) organized into two cycles: Newspaper Cycle (1858–1930, 30 issues) and Magazine Cycle (1882–2009, 13 issues).

data.title: Fluorescence Correlation Spectroscopy (FCS) Unlocks the Presence of Microcystin-LR in Water
data.sub_theme: water contamination detection
data.summary: Fluorescence correlation spectroscopy detects microcystin-LR toxin in water with a limit of detection of 0.18 nM, below WHO safety thresholds.

data.title: ERP user satisfaction as situated practice: compensatory dynamics among management controllers in Morocco
data.sub_theme: ERP system satisfaction in developing economies
data.summary: A qualitative study of 20 Moroccan management controllers reveals that ERP satisfaction emerges from compensatory coping practices rather than system quality alone, anchored in organizational constraints.

data.title: Noam Chomsky and the End of Counterculture: Performing Dissent and 'Sunsteinization'
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: media criticism, intellectual dissent
data.summary: An analytical case study examining how intellectual dissent, exemplified by Noam Chomsky, is reconfigured into performative visibility within platform capitalism rather than oppositional critique.

data.title: Compression Efficiency and Structural Learning as a Computational Model of DLN Cognitive Stages
data.sub_theme: cognitive development computational model
data.summary: A computational model instantiates three cognitive stages (Dot, Linear, Network) from the DLN framework using graph-structured belief representations, showing Network policies dominate at large problem scales.

data.title: From Test Case Design to Test Data Generation: How AI is Transforming End-to-End Quality Assurance in Agile and DevOps Environments
data.sub_theme: AI in software quality assurance
data.summary: A review of AI's transformative role in quality assurance processes, examining automated test case design, synthetic test data generation, and integration with CI/CD pipelines in Agile/DevOps environments.

data.title: Schumpeterian disaggregation and integrated assessment: An endogenous, stock-flow consistent economy in disequilibrium for FRIDA v2.1
data.sub_theme: integrated climate-economic modeling
data.summary: FRIDA v2.1 is a disequilibrium macroeconomic model incorporating monetary dynamics and endogenous innovation for climate impact assessment, showing climate effects propagate through investment growth and financial fragility.

data.title: Noam Chomsky and the End of Counterculture: Performing Dissent and 'Sunsteinization'
data.summary: This article analyzes media systems and dissent in the digital age using Noam Chomsky as a case study; it is not about sports.

data.title: Noam Chomsky and the End of Counterculture: Performing Dissent and 'Sunsteinization'
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: This article analyzes media systems and dissent in the digital age using Noam Chomsky as a case study; it is not about sports.

data.title: Integrating Community Economy Context-Based Learning and Entrepreneurship Education to Enhance Entrepreneurial Language Skills
data.sub_theme: entrepreneurship education, Thai language instruction
data.summary: This study develops and evaluates a community-economy context-based learning model to integrate entrepreneurship education into Thai-language instruction for Grade 12 students; it is not about sports.

data.title: Reframing Organizational Decision-Making in the Age of Artificial Intelligence: A Conceptual Review of Human–AI Augmentation
data.journal: INTERANTIONAL JOURNAL OF SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH IN ENGINEERING AND MANAGEMENT
data.sub_theme: human-AI augmentation in organizational decision-making
data.summary: Conceptual meta-analysis synthesizing literature on AI-augmented organizational decision-making, proposing a framework that positions AI as augmentation rather than substitution for human judgment.

data.title: Digital Physical Exercise Interventions for Cognitive Functions in Older Adults: Systematic Review and Bayesian Network Meta-Analysis (Preprint)
data.sub_theme: digital physical exercise interventions for cognitive function in older adults
data.summary: Bayesian network meta-analysis of 41 RCTs with 2919 older adults found immersive VR most effective for global cognition (SUCRA=96.6%) and memory function (SUCRA=82.8%), while remote exercise and non-immersive exergames ranked highest for executive function.

data.title: Zihinsel Gücün İzinde: Sporda Psikolojik Sağlamlık Araştırmalarının Bibliyometrik Haritası
data.journal: The Online Journal of Recreation and Sport
data.sub_theme: bibliometric analysis of psychological resilience research in sport
data.summary: Bibliometric analysis of 749 articles on psychological resilience in sport (1983-2025) identified 28,069 total citations, with University of Granada as leading institution and COVID-19 pandemic increasing focus on mental health and online learning.

data.title: Hormonal and Inflammatory Mechanisms of Dysmenorrhea and Implications for Targeted, Multimodal Management: An Updated Narrative Review
data.sub_theme: hormonal and inflammatory mechanisms of dysmenorrhea
data.summary: Narrative review of 29 studies characterizes dysmenorrhea as a neuroendocrine-inflammatory disorder involving progesterone withdrawal, COX-2 upregulation, excess prostaglandins, and pro-inflammatory cytokines, supporting multimodal therapeutic approaches.

data.title: Modifiable and Non-Modifiable Predictors of Exercise Capacity in Stroke Survivors: A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: predictors of exercise capacity in stroke survivors
data.summary: Systematic review of 17 studies identified modifiable predictors (BMI, lower limb strength, baseline VO2peak, training intensity) and non-modifiable predictors (age, sex, diabetes, stroke-specific factors) of exercise capacity in stroke rehabilitation.

data.title: Blackcurrant Anthocyanin Supplementation Alters Exercise-Induced Substrate Utilization - A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: blackcurrant anthocyanin supplementation and substrate utilization during exercise
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 15 studies with 226 physically active adults found blackcurrant supplementation increased fat oxidation (0.042 g·min⁻¹) and decreased carbohydrate oxidation (-0.099 g·min⁻¹) during exercise, with responses varying by training status, sex, and dosage.

data.title: How We Sleep, How We Move, How Long We Expect to Live: An Integrative Review of Lifestyle Behaviors and Subjective Life Expectancy
data.sub_theme: sleep, physical activity, and subjective life expectancy in aging
data.summary: Narrative review of 2015-2025 literature identifies sleep quality and physical activity as core behavioral determinants of healthy aging, operating through metabolic, inflammatory, and psychological pathways, with subjective life expectancy as a central mediator of adherence.

data.title: Telecoaching Interventions for People with Epilepsy: Enhancing Physical Activity and Quality of Life through Digital Health. A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: telecoaching, epilepsy management
data.summary: Systematic review of 7 telecoaching-based physical activity interventions in people with epilepsy found them feasible and safe with potential benefits for physical fitness and psychosocial outcomes, though limited evidence precludes definitive conclusions on seizure control.

data.title: Impact of the built environment on physical activity and obesity in Hungarian and Jordanian women: A comparative study
data.sub_theme: built environment and physical activity
data.summary: Cross-sectional survey of 800 women in Hungary and Jordan found that supportive urban environments with safe walking infrastructure and reduced car dependency are associated with higher physical activity levels and lower BMI.

data.title: Optimizing triple jump performance and knee biomechanics in junior figure skaters: a longitudinal evaluation of rotational harness training in Kazakhstan
data.sub_theme: rotational harness training and triple jump biomechanics
data.summary: Longitudinal 36-month study of 28 female junior figure skaters found that rotational harness training reduced peak ground reaction forces (5.6 vs 7.3 × body weight), increased knee flexion, and accelerated triple-jump mastery while reducing knee pathology incidence and improving psychological confidence.

data.title: Exploratory Factor Analyses of the Female and Male Body Checking Questionnaires in Collegiate Athletes
data.sub_theme: body checking and body image in collegiate athletes
data.summary: Exploratory factor analysis of 174 collegiate athletes (86 female, 84 male) validated reduced-item versions of the Body Checking Questionnaire (12 items, two factors) and Male Body Checking Questionnaire (11 items, three factors) with high internal consistency for athlete populations.

data.title: The Impact of Coaching Leadership Style on Motivation and Team Cohesion in Volleyball
data.journal: Proceedings of The International Conference on Future of Teaching and Education
data.sub_theme: leadership style effects on motivation and team cohesion
data.summary: Mixed-methods study of 28 female Albanian volleyball players (aged 16-25) found democratic and transformational coaching leadership styles associated with higher intrinsic motivation, athlete satisfaction, and team cohesion, while autocratic styles reduced commitment and social bonds.

data.title: Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport (REDs) and site-specific bone mineral density in female adolescent artistic athletes
data.sub_theme: Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport and bone mineral density in adolescent female artistic athletes
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 74 female adolescent artistic athletes (artistic swimmers, dancers, figure skaters) aged 9-19 found 45.9% had ≥1 Relative Energy Deficiency indicator, with higher BMD in dancers and figure skaters relative to artistic swimmers, emphasizing need for RED screening in artistic sports.

data.title: Metabolic Bone Disease in Athletes
data.sub_theme: metabolic bone disease in athletes
data.summary: Narrative review of metabolic bone disease in athletes identifies dysregulated bone turnover from hormonal imbalances and training excess as key mechanisms, with female athletes with menstrual irregularities and energy deficits at particular risk for osteoporosis, and recommends nutritional optimization and bone screening.

data.title: Magnetic Field Modulates Butterfly-Hysteretic Formaldehyde Response in Sm-Doped BiFeO <sub>3</sub> Sensors
data.summary: Study develops a formaldehyde gas sensor using samarium-doped bismuth ferrite with magnetic field modulation; not related to sports.

data.title: Facile Synthesis of pH-Adaptive Ascorbate Peroxidase-like Nanozyme for One-Step Enzyme-Nanozyme Cascade Biosensing
data.summary: Paper describes development of a copper-doped nanozyme for biodetection via cascade fluorescence sensing; not related to sports.

data.title: Self-Powered Wireless System for Sleep Apnea Syndrome Self-Management Using π-Conjugated Poly(benzodifurandione)-Based Low-Hysteresis Humidity Sensors and Highly Sensitive Pressure Sensors
data.summary: Study develops self-powered wireless sensor system for sleep apnea monitoring using conducting polymers; not related to sports.

data.title: Improved Carrier Transport and Enhanced Stability through Defect Reduction via Zn <sup>2+</sup> Doping in 0D Hybrid Manganese Halides for X-ray Detectors
data.summary: Paper develops zinc-doped manganese halide X-ray detectors for medical imaging applications; not related to sports.

data.title: The Impact of Isometric and Isotonic Exercises on the Reduction of Shoulder Muscle Injuries in Volleyball Players
data.journal: Proceedings of The International Conference on Future of Teaching and Education
data.sub_theme: shoulder injury prevention, isometric vs isotonic training
data.summary: Randomized trial comparing isometric and isotonic shoulder conditioning programs in university volleyball players found isometric training reduced injury incidence by 58% compared to 46% for isotonic training.

data.title: Supply Chain Risk Management of Molded Palm Sugar at Besan Village, Dawan District, Klungkung Regency, Bali Province, Indonesia
data.journal: Advances in Social Sciences Research Journal
data.sub_theme: palm sugar supply chain risk management
data.summary: Supply chain risk analysis of molded palm sugar production using SCOR, FMEA, and AHP methods identifies critical risks in sap supply and product quality across production actors.

data.title: From Injury to Impact: Optimizing Return-to-Play Outcomes and Reinjury Prevention via Four-Pillar Rehabilitation Strategy in Elite Football—A Clinical Study in a Sports Scenario
data.sub_theme: return-to-play, load management, reinjury prevention
data.summary: Three-year observational clinical study of OFI Crete FC implementing a four-pillar rehabilitation framework achieved 60% reduction in injury rates and 10% reinjury rate across 87 elite players.

data.title: The performative face in "Egils saga Skallagrímssonar"
data.journal: Publication Server of Goethe University Frankfurt am Main (Goethe University Frankfurt)
data.sub_theme: facial expression in Icelandic saga narrative
data.summary: Literary analysis of performative facial expressions and somatic gestures in early thirteenth-century Icelandic saga Egils saga Skallagrímssonar examining emotional and social communication.

data.title: Determinants of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Disclosure and Its Effects on Financial Performance: Evidence from Agroindustry and Environmentally Sensitive Firms in Indonesia
data.journal: Asian Journal of Economics Business and Accounting
data.sub_theme: ESG disclosure and financial performance
data.summary: Multiple linear regression analysis of 234 Indonesian agroindustry and high-pollution firms shows ESG disclosure has significant positive effect on return on assets.

data.title: Islamic corporate governance and the financial performance of Sharia banks
data.sub_theme: Islamic corporate governance and banking performance
data.summary: Multiple linear regression of 13 Indonesian Islamic banks shows number of Sharia Supervisory Board members has significant positive effect on profitability and negative effect on non-performing financing.

data.title: Pitfalls and How to Avoid Misdiagnosis in Magnetic Resonance Imaging of the Ankle and Foot in Athletes
data.sub_theme: MRI interpretation, ankle and foot imaging in athletes
data.summary: Narrative review of magnetic resonance imaging pitfalls in ankle and foot evaluation emphasizes importance of correlating imaging findings with clinical assessment to avoid overtreatment and support safe return to play in athletes.

data.title: From Social Ties to Social Responsibility: How Social Capital Shapes CSR Practices Around the World
data.journal: Journal of risk and financial management
data.sub_theme: social capital and corporate social responsibility
data.summary: Cross-national analysis of 61 countries finds firms in high-social-capital countries exhibit higher corporate social responsibility engagement and CSR has greater value-enhancing effects in low-social-capital settings.

data.summary: Literary analysis of facial expressions and performative gestures in medieval Icelandic saga narrative, examining embodiment and emotional communication.

data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 43 high school basketball players found no significant correlation between agility score or ankle flexibility and ankle injury risk using Spearman rank correlation.

data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)

data.title: How Emerging Digital Health Technologies Based on Dietary and Physical Activity Regulation Improve Metabolic Syndrome-Related Outcomes in Adolescents: A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: digital health technologies for metabolic syndrome in adolescents
data.summary: Systematic review of 12 RCTs (2012-2025) found digital health interventions combining physical activity and nutrition (moderate-to-high intensity, 3-6 months) improved metabolic syndrome outcomes including anthropometric and biochemical markers in adolescents.

data.title: Gut Microbiota and Exercise-Induced Fatigue: A Narrative Review of Mechanisms, Nutritional Interventions, and Future Directions
data.sub_theme: gut microbiota mechanisms in exercise-induced fatigue and nutritional interventions
data.summary: Narrative review identified four interconnected microbiota-mediated pathways in exercise-induced fatigue (energy/metabolism, redox balance, barrier integrity, gut-brain signaling) and found targeted probiotics and prebiotics show promise for improving fatigue biomarkers and endurance outcomes.

data.title: Resistance training for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease:a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease, resistance exercise
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 11 RCTs found that resistance exercise significantly decreased ALT levels and hepatic steatosis in patients with MASLD, with recommended dosage of 8-10 whole-body exercises at 60-80% 1RM performed 3+ times weekly for 12+ weeks.

data.title: Mapping scientific knowledge and future directions on exercise and depression: A bibliometric study
data.sub_theme: bibliometric analysis of exercise and depression literature
data.summary: Bibliometric mapping of 1983-2022 literature on exercise and depression identified aerobic exercise and tai chi as promising interventions targeting the hippocampus and BDNF, with the US and China as leading research sources.

data.title: Sulla definizione di cittadino nel libro III della Politica: il metodo di Aristotele tra theoria, empeiria e storia delle praxeis

data.sub_theme: Aristotle's definition of citizenship in ancient political theory
data.summary: Philosophical analysis of Aristotle's treatment of citizenship in Book III of the Politics, examining the relationship between political responsibility, sovereignty, and civic participation in ancient Greek poleis.

data.title: NSAID Use Is Not Associated With Persisting Symptoms in Adolescent Concussion
data.sub_theme: concussion recovery, NSAID use in adolescents
data.summary: Prospective cohort study of 118 adolescent concussion patients finding that while NSAID use was associated with more severe initial symptoms, it was not associated with persisting post-concussion symptoms at 28+ days.

data.title: Cross Bracing Protocol for Anterior Cruciate Ligament (ACL) Rupture Has Unacceptably High Failure Rate Relative to Surgical Stabilization: A 2-year Controlled Cohort Study
data.sub_theme: ACL rupture, cross-bracing vs surgical stabilization
data.summary: Two-year prospective cohort study comparing cross-bracing protocol to surgical ACL reconstruction in 80 athletes, showing the non-surgical protocol had unacceptably high failure rates (70% recurrent instability vs 2.5% with surgery) in pivoting sports participants.

data.title: Relationship Between Sport Specialization and Short-Term Health-Related Quality of Life in Youth Athletes After Injury
data.sub_theme: sport specialization, health-related quality of life after injury, sex differences
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 336 injured youth athletes (8-18 years) finding no association between sport specialization level and short-term health-related quality of life post-injury, but female athletes reported worse HRQoL scores than males across pain, depression, and anxiety measures.

data.title: The Anatomy of Excellence: A Multidimensional Analysis of Physiological and Performance Determinants Distinguishing Elite from Sub-Elite Handball Players

data.sub_theme: talent identification, elite vs sub-elite discrimination, multidimensional profiling
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 60 male handball players comparing elite and sub-elite players across anthropometry, physiology, sport-specific performance, and cognitive skills, with discriminant analysis identifying four variables that correctly classified 93.3% of players by elite status.

data.title: Research Progress of Proteasome Inhibitor MG132 in Treatment of Gynecologic Malignant Tumors

data.sub_theme: proteasome inhibitor MG132 in gynecologic malignant tumor treatment
data.summary: A narrative review consolidates research on the therapeutic potential of the proteasome inhibitor MG132 in gynecologic oncology, focusing on its mechanisms including cell cycle regulation, NF-κB signaling inhibition, and p53 modulation.

data.title: Association Between Functional Muscle Assessment and Psychological Factors on Return to Sport and Graft Failure After ACL Reconstruction
data.sub_theme: psychological profiles and ACL reinjury risk, return to sport
data.summary: Psychological profiles combined with muscle strength assessment predicted ACL return-to-sport outcomes; athletes with high confidence and low anxiety achieved 77.8% RTS rate versus 45.8% in high-anxiety/depressive profiles, with females overrepresented in negative profiles.

data.title: PREVALENCE OF T-WAVE INVERSION IN FEMALE ATHLETES COMPARED TO MALES
data.sub_theme: sex differences in ECG findings, T-wave inversion in young athletes
data.summary: Female high school athletes showed higher prevalence of isolated T-wave inversion in leads V1–V3 (OR 2.15) compared with males; abnormal ECGs were rare (2%) and none of the female TWI cases were associated with sudden cardiac death risk.

data.title: EVALUATION OF THE CAUSES OF GROIN PAIN IN ORTHOPEDIC OUTPATIENT PRACTICE
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: groin pain etiologies in general population
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 99 outpatients with groin pain identified fractures (26.26%), avascular necrosis (15.15%), and disc prolapse (14.14%) as leading etiologies; study focused on general population rather than athletic cohorts despite mentioning traditional athletic association.

data.title: EVALUATION OF THE CAUSES OF GROIN PAIN IN ORTHOPEDIC OUTPATIENT PRACTICE
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: groin pain etiology in general population
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 99 general outpatient patients (not athletes) identified fractures, avascular necrosis, and disc prolapse as the most common causes of groin pain, with mechanical signs like the 'C sign' present in 71.7% of cases.

data.title: All-Inside and All-Knotless Soft Tissue Anchor Repair for Chronic Lateral Ankle Instability: A Retrospective Study of a New Surgical Technique
data.sub_theme: ankle ligament repair outcomes
data.summary: Retrospective study of 36 athletes (64% male) undergoing arthroscopic knotless anchor repair for chronic lateral ankle instability showed excellent outcomes with AOFAS scores improving from 61 to 96 at 12 months, with 91.7% patient satisfaction.

data.summary: This paper on nitrogen and sulfur co-doped carbon dots for palladium detection is not related to sports.

data.title: Interest in Working Remotely: What Factors Are at Play?
data.journal: Journal of Software Evolution and Process

data.title: Pengaruh Return On Equity (ROE), Debt To Equity Ratio (DER), dan Inflasi Terhadap Return Saham Perusahaan Sektor Keuangan di Bursa Efek Indonesia Periode 2019-2023

data.title: Nutritional Potential of Low-Carbohydrate Nigerian Staple Meal Alternatives for Improving Dietary Compliance in Starch-Restricted Populations

data.summary: Nutritional analysis of low-carbohydrate Nigerian meal alternatives showed acceptable sensory properties and nutrient density suitable for diabetes dietary management.

data.summary: Theoretical review synthesizing portfolio theory and behavioral finance to provide integrated understanding of asset allocation decision-making under varying market conditions.

data.title: Pengaruh Pengendalian Manajemen Piutang Terhadap Likuiditas dan Profitabilitas PT Bank Syariah Indonesia yang Terdaftar di Bursa Efek Indonesia
data.sub_theme: accounts receivable management, bank financial performance
data.summary: Quantitative analysis of a digital bank found shorter DSO and higher receivable turnover strongly associated with improved ROA, ROE, and LDR metrics.

data.title: Longitudinal Genome‐Wide Association Study for Female Fertility Traits in German Holstein Cattle
data.sub_theme: genome-wide association, female fertility in cattle, dairy breeding
data.summary: Longitudinal GWAS in Holstein cattle identified five candidate genes (TMEM132C, IMPG1, DCHS2, CSMD1, CSNK1A1) influencing dynamic female fertility traits across lactations.

data.sub_theme: bank liquidity and credit risk, digital banking
data.summary: Multiple regression analysis of Indonesian digital banks found LDR significantly and positively predicts ROA while NPL does not, indicating liquidity management importance.

data.sub_theme: bowel cancer screening, general practice, patient participation
data.summary: Qualitative Delphi study found general practitioners view Australian bowel cancer screening as beneficial but identified inefficiencies in patient tracking and referral interfaces.

data.title: The effect of historical present as a technique for organizing time in Hilary Mantel's novel "The Mirror and the Light"
data.sub_theme: narrative technique, historical present tense, literary analysis
data.summary: Linguistic and narrative analysis of Hilary Mantel's novel demonstrates how praesens historicum technique organizes time and creates psychological presence in historical fiction.

data.sub_theme: vestibular function, cochlear implant, elderly patients
data.summary: Observational study comparing vestibular outcomes in older (≥65) versus younger cochlear implant patients found age ≥65 a risk factor for postoperative dizziness worsening.

data.title: Illuminating the renal response to pH stress with single-nucleus RNA sequencing
data.sub_theme: renal pH response, single-nucleus RNA sequencing
data.summary: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing reveals sex-specific transcriptional responses of kidney cells to metabolic acidosis and alkalosis in mice, identifying a novel proximal tubule cell cluster arising from pH challenge.

data.journal: Renewable Energies Environment and Power Quality Journal
data.sub_theme: HVDC fault modeling
data.summary: Dynamic modeling framework for bipolar HVDC links with metallic return enables asymmetric fault simulation in power systems.

data.journal: International Journal of Computer Information Systems and Industrial Management Applications

data.summary: Integrated dual-stream CNN-LSTM model with motion trajectory tracking and knowledge graphs to identify basketball training movement patterns and generate personalized technical improvement recommendations for players.

data.title: The silent few: An ethnographic study of gender perceptions in the Syracuse University esports community
data.sub_theme: gender discrimination, toxic male culture, in-game communication
data.summary: Ethnographic study of Syracuse University esports community revealed persistent gender inequity through toxic in-game communication ('comms'), male homosocial dynamics, and normalization of discriminatory behaviors that exclude women gamers.

data.title: Effect of high dose of Zinc on increasing IFN-γ levels
data.journal: Tropical Journal of Natural Product Research
data.summary: Experimental study on rats demonstrates that high-dose zinc supplementation (0.15 mg) effectively increases IFN-γ levels while maintaining optimal TGF-β levels for immune response.

data.summary: Quality improvement project finds that advance care planning documentation in 78% of acute frailty unit patients results in low 30-day readmission rates (2%) and better outcomes.

data.summary: Auditory Analytics introduces a methodological framework using data sonification to analyze complex systems, illustrated through protein folding dynamics where auditory pattern recognition identified hydrogen-bonding patterns affecting protein state transitions.

data.sub_theme: activated carbon adsorption
data.summary: Activated carbon from Eucalyptus wood was characterized and evaluated for methyl orange removal using kinetic and thermodynamic analysis, demonstrating pseudo-second-order adsorption behavior and regeneration potential over four cycles.

data.summary: A theoretical model based on Herschel-Bulkley fluid mechanics was developed to calculate mud flow direction, circulation pressure, and drilling parameters in large-scale horizontal directional drilling projects, validated through engineering case studies.

data.summary: A theoretical framework (Cymatic K-Space Mechanics) proposes a geometric derivation of Euler's number e as the unique saturation constant required for phase diffusion on hexagonal manifolds, claiming e is a structural necessity rather than abstract mathematical discovery.

data.title: Determinants of Consistent Board Exam Excellence among Top-Performing Accountancy Schools in Cebu City
data.journal: International Review of Management and Marketing
data.sub_theme: CPA licensure exam success factors
data.summary: A predictive-correlational study of 150 respondents from accountancy schools in Cebu City identified student study motivation (β=0.459) as the strongest predictor of CPA board exam performance, followed by institutional strategies and faculty teaching practices.

data.title: Two TaqMan real-time quantitative PCR assays for the detection of Alongshan virus, a new member of the tick-borne Flaviviridae family

data.summary: Two TaqMan real-time qPCR assays targeting NS3 and NS5 genes were developed and validated for Alongshan virus detection with limits of detection of 100 copies per reaction (or 5-2 copies when performed in triplicate) and demonstrated high reproducibility.

data.title: A multidimensional framework for assessing productive and ecosystem potential of wild animal species: insights from Latin America
data.sub_theme: wildlife productive and ecosystem potential assessment

data.title: A Review on Electrochemical and Optical Nanobiosensor for the Detection of Progesterone and Estradiol

data.summary: Review of electrochemical and optical nanobiosensor techniques for detecting progesterone and estradiol hormones in clinical and research applications.

data.title: The transformation of football clubs from social associations to commercial organizations
data.sub_theme: organizational transformation, commercialization history
data.summary: A historical-analytical study identified key stages in the transformation of football clubs from social associations to commercial organizations, driven by legalization of professional status, media deregulation, and global commercial impulses across England, Italy, and Spain.

data.title: Effect of Hypoxic Exercise with Different Oxygen Concentrations on Metabolic Outcomes in Obesity: A Systematic Review and Network Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: hypoxic exercise, obesity, body composition, glucose and lipid metabolism
data.summary: A network meta-analysis of 14 studies (n=189) found that moderate hypoxic exercise (12–14% FiO2) significantly reduced BMI, fasting blood glucose, triglycerides, and LDL-C in obese individuals, while higher oxygen concentrations were more effective for insulin sensitivity, providing personalized intervention guidance.

data.title: Research trends in unhealthy weight management behavior and social media influence among women in emerging adulthood: Systematic review
data.sub_theme: social media influence on eating disorders and body image
data.summary: Systematic review found that social media platforms promote self-objectification and body comparison among emerging adult women, contributing to unhealthy weight management behaviors including disordered eating and excessive exercise.

data.title: Effects of coenzyme Q10 analogs on oxidative stress, muscle, and metabolism after exercise: A meta-analysis and systematic review
data.sub_theme: coenzyme Q10 supplementation for oxidative stress and muscle damage
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 14 RCTs (n=433) found that oral coenzyme Q10 supplementation reduced exercise-induced oxidative stress (malondialdehyde) and muscle damage (creatine kinase) but had no effect on aerobic or anaerobic metabolism.

data.title: Home Exercise Therapy in Patients with Stable Congestive Heart Failure (CHF): A Scoping Review
data.sub_theme: home exercise therapy for congestive heart failure
data.summary: Scoping review examined home exercise therapy outcomes in stable congestive heart failure patients, identifying evidence for physical activity as adjunct to pharmaceutical treatment for improving cardiovascular function.

data.title: 3659 The effects of unilateral upper limb motor control training on cognitive function in older adults
data.sub_theme: motor control training effects on cognitive function in older adults
data.summary: 4-week unilateral upper-limb motor control training in 20 older adults (≥65 years) significantly improved executive function and attention (Trail Making Test, Montreal Cognitive Assessment, Stroop test) with benefits sustained at 4-week follow-up, though BDNF and IL-2 biomarkers were unchanged.

data.title: Political-institutional aspects of decision-making of lay judges: a proposal for behavioral intervention in the education of jurors

data.summary: Comparative analysis of lay judge decision-making in Slovak Republic, Czech Republic, Austria, and Sweden identified cognitive biases affecting judicial impartiality and proposes training interventions to improve quality of verdicts.

data.title: Non-Pharmacological Interventions for Emotional Symptoms in COPD Centered on Anxiety and Depression: An Evidence Synthesis Study
data.sub_theme: non-pharmacological interventions for anxiety and depression in COPD
data.summary: Umbrella review of 13 articles found physical exercise training as the strongest intervention (Level 1a evidence) for anxiety and depression in moderate-to-severe COPD, followed by pulmonary rehabilitation and cognitive-behavioral therapy.

data.title: Kinesiophobia in Patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease: A Concept Analysis
data.sub_theme: kinesiophobia (fear of movement) in COPD patients
data.summary: Concept analysis of 29 studies identified four defining attributes of kinesiophobia in COPD (symptom hypervigilance, maladaptive cognition, emotional responses, behavioral avoidance) and proposed a unified conceptual framework to guide interventions.

data.title: Perceptions of best practice, pain science and structure-focused education for rotator cuff-related shoulder pain: a content analysis of qualitative data from a randomised experiment
data.sub_theme: education approaches for rotator cuff shoulder pain management
data.summary: Content analysis of 2,237 participants with rotator cuff shoulder pain randomized to three education types found best practice education with pain science messages fostered self-management and reduced preference for unnecessary treatments (imaging, injections, surgery) compared to structure-focused education.

data.title: Beyond Stigma&ndash;Integrating Neurobiology, Genetics, and Awareness Integration Theory in Addiction Recovery
data.summary: Paper on addiction recovery neurobiology and genetics with no apparent connection to sport or athletes.

data.summary: Case study of a professional ballroom dancer's physiological adaptation during transition from competitive dance to sustained theatrical performance on ocean liners, revealing ankle-to-knee injury redistribution and relative energy deficiency risk under prolonged contract cycles.

data.title: Nitrogen‐Doped Carbon Quantum Dots for Tannic Acid Analysis in Complex Food Matrices
data.summary: This paper on nitrogen-doped carbon quantum dots for tannic acid detection in food is not related to sports.

data.summary: A review of recent metabolomic panel developments (2020-2025) for non-invasive prostate cancer monitoring via urine and plasma biomarkers, examining LC-MS, NMR, and machine learning approaches for disease stratification and dietary response assessment.

data.title: Cluster-Based Flare-Gas Aggregation in the Niger Delta and Empirical Gas-to-Power Modelling for Enhanced Energy Security in Nigeria
data.journal: Journal of Engineering Research and Reports
data.sub_theme: flare-gas energy recovery modeling
data.summary: Cluster-based geospatial modeling and process simulation estimated 578 MW of recoverable power generation capacity from flare-gas aggregation in the Niger Delta oil fields using empirical gas-to-power regression.

data.title: An Approach to Analytical Minimalism in Cinema: Il Buco (2021)
data.sub_theme: film analysis and minimalism
data.summary: Analytical study of Michelangelo Frammartino's film Il Buco (2021) applies Kovács's analytical minimalism theory to examine cinematographic and narrative techniques.

data.title: An inventory model on compounding interaction effects between quality uncertainty, human inspection fallibility, credit financing strategies, and bad debt losses
data.sub_theme: inventory supply chain modeling
data.summary: Mathematical inventory model with three tiers quantifies interaction effects between quality uncertainty, inspection errors, and credit financing on profit optimization in imperfect supply chains.

data.title: Potential roles of metabolomic alterations in neuropathic pain: Evidence from In Vivo to clinical studies
data.sub_theme: neuropathic pain metabolomics
data.summary: Systematic review synthesizes evidence from animal and clinical studies demonstrating metabolomic alterations in amino acids, fatty acids, and phospholipids associated with neuropathic pain pathogenesis.

data.title: Strengthening public health graduate competencies through field-based learning: A case study at Diponegoro University
data.sub_theme: public health competency assessment
data.summary: Descriptive case study of 20 student reports from field-based learning demonstrated that structured problem-solving cycles effectively develop technical and interpersonal public health competencies.

data.title: Ultrafast Multilevel Switching and Synaptic Behavior in a Planar Quantum Topological Memristor
data.sub_theme: quantum topological memristor device
data.summary: Development of ultrafast planar quantum topological memristor using bismuth-telluride thin film achieved record 15ns switching speed and demonstrated multilevel resistive switching for neuromorphic computing applications.

data.title: Primary Schools as Actors at the Energy Transition
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: energy transition and school engagement
data.summary: Participatory action research study examined the STENEO project's role in building school resilience and social innovation capacity during the energy transition.

data.title: Digitalisation as a Transformation Vector for the Accounting Profession in the New Global Economy — A Practical Approach
data.sub_theme: accounting digitalization
data.summary: Analysis of digital transformation in accounting demonstrates how ERP systems, AI, and automation reshape the profession from transaction recording toward strategic advisory and data interpretation.

data.title: Targeted saliva multi-omics is a reliable, non-invasive method to capture physiological stress and recovery
data.sub_theme: salivary multi-omics, physiological monitoring, recovery
data.summary: A machine learning analysis of over 12,000 saliva samples from elite football players over 16 months demonstrated that targeted multi-omics reliably discriminates between exercise and recovery states, providing a non-invasive framework for monitoring physical performance.

data.title: Islamic Economics and Finance for a Sustainable Humane Economy: Whither Homo Islamicus?
data.sub_theme: Islamic economics and sustainable development
data.summary: A conceptual essay argues that homo Islamicus (the Islamic economic agent) should be central to Islamic economics and finance as a framework for sustainable humane economy and policy design.

data.title: Effects of six traditional exercise therapies on key clinical outcomes in patients with chronic heart failure: A systematic review and network meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: traditional exercise therapies for chronic heart failure
data.summary: A network meta-analysis of 34 studies (2521 participants) found that traditional exercise therapies (Liuzijue, Tai Chi, Baduanjin, yoga) significantly improved quality of life, exercise tolerance, NT-proBNP, and left ventricular ejection fraction in chronic heart failure patients, with Liuzijue and Baduanjin showing the strongest benefits.

data.title: Nordic Questionnaire Use in Work‐Related Musculoskeletal Injury Surveys Among Surgeons
data.sub_theme: musculoskeletal injury assessment in surgeons
data.summary: A systematic review of 26 studies found inconsistent modifications to the Nordic Musculoskeletal Questionnaire in surgeon populations, with recommendations for a standardized survey incorporating ergonomic, occupational, and lifestyle variables to improve comparability and intervention design.

data.title: How Does Early, Midday, and Late Time-Restricted Eating Impact Anthropometry and Cardiometabolic Health? A Systematic Review and Network Meta-Analysis of RCTs
data.sub_theme: time-restricted eating and cardiometabolic health
data.summary: A Bayesian network meta-analysis of 40 RCTs (3259 subjects) found that early time-restricted eating, particularly combined with exercise, produced superior improvements in glucoregulation and anthropometric measures compared to other time-restricted eating patterns and calorie restriction in adults with cardiometabolic risk.

data.title: Association, Affect, and Material Reading Practices of Anna Laetitia Barbauld
data.journal: ABO Interactive Journal for Women in the Arts 1640-1830
data.sub_theme: 18th century reading practices and poetry analysis
data.summary: A feminist formalist literary analysis traces association psychology's influence on Romantic-era poets, demonstrating how Anna Laetitia Barbauld's poetic work emphasizes embodied, affective reading practices in contrast to detached scientific discourse.

data.title: A systematic review and meta-analysis of the mechanism of action of Tai Chi on cardiovascular disease: evidence map of aerobic and mind-body exercise pathways
data.sub_theme: cardiovascular health, Tai Chi, aerobic exercise
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 60 studies (39 RCTs) found Tai Chi significantly reduced systolic and diastolic blood pressure, improved HDL cholesterol and functional capacity, with evidence suggesting effects on autonomic regulation and inflammatory pathways comparable to aerobic exercise.

data.title: Fusing mechanistic networks and machine learning to control heart growth
data.sub_theme: cardiac hypertrophy modeling, gene regulatory networks
data.summary: Methods combining mechanistic network modeling with machine learning to develop computational models of cardiac regulatory networks for understanding heart hypertrophy and targeting drug therapy.

data.title: Time-efficient and beneficial strategy: low-volume high-intensity interval training for cardiometabolic health and body composition outcomes in children and adolescents with overweight or obesity—a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: HIIT in obese children, cardiometabolic outcomes, body composition
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 12 RCTs (609 pediatric participants) found low-volume HIIT significantly reduced BMI, body fat, waist circumference, blood pressure, and increased VO2max compared to controls, with greater BMI and VO2max improvements versus moderate-intensity continuous training.

data.title: Effectiveness of music therapy for children with autism spectrum disorder: meta-analysis and potential biological mechanisms
data.sub_theme: music therapy for autism spectrum disorder
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 18 studies found music therapy significantly reduced autism behavior checklist and CARS scores, improving social skills, behavioral abilities, sensory, emotional, and verbal functioning in children with autism spectrum disorder.

data.title: Differences Between Perceived and Recommended Nutritional Needs Among Three Division I Female Sports Teams
data.sub_theme: nutritional knowledge gaps, female athletes, sport-specific differences
data.summary: NCAA Division I female athletes across soccer, softball, and volleyball consistently underestimated nutritional requirements, with discrepancies worsening at higher training intensities despite sport-specific variations being minimal.

data.title: Irish dual career athlete transitions into the US collegiate system
data.sub_theme: international athlete transition, dual career support
data.summary: Irish dual career athletes transitioning to US collegiate system experience three distinct phases; qualitative analysis identified gaps in pre-transition preparation, coach liaison, and mental health support as key factors influencing successful adaptation.

data.title: Effects of repeated administration of oxandrolone in female wistar rats undergoing strength training
data.journal: The Journal of Steroid Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
data.sub_theme: anabolic steroid toxicology
data.summary: Oxandrolone administration in female rats undergoing strength training showed limited anabolic effects on muscle strength but induced cardiac and skeletal muscle damage with increased liver oxidative stress, raising safety concerns for athletic use.

data.title: Return to Sports After Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Prospective Cohort Study of 1782 Patients

data.sub_theme: return to sport after total knee arthroplasty, RTS outcomes
data.summary: Among 1,464 athletes following total knee arthroplasty, 53.4% returned to sport within one year (median 12 weeks), with RTS rates varying significantly by competitive level, sex (females lower), race, BMI, and insurance status.

data.sub_theme: pedagogical control, technical-tactical readiness assessment
data.summary: Specialized pedagogical control exercises effectively assessed technical-tactical readiness in U15 football players, demonstrating improved quick decision-making and working memory capabilities.

data.title: Improvement of fast attacks in 16-17-year-old football players
data.journal: Uchenye zapiski universiteta imeni P F Lesgafta
data.sub_theme: fast attack optimization, tactical effectiveness
data.summary: A developed set of technical-tactical exercises significantly improved the effectiveness of fast attacks in 16-17-year-old football players compared to controls.

data.title: Climates of Terrestrial Exoplanets and Biosignatures
data.summary: Development of climate models and atmospheric retrieval techniques to assess habitability of terrestrial exoplanets and detectability of biosignatures across diverse planetary regimes.

data.title: Analysis of the User Experience of Auto-Battler Magic Chess: Go Go Game using Game Experience Questionnaire (GEQ)
data.journal: Proceedings of the National Conference on Electrical Engineering Informatics Industrial Technology and Creative Media
data.sub_theme: user experience, player satisfaction
data.summary: Descriptive analysis of Game Experience Questionnaire responses from 100 Magic Chess: Go Go players shows strong positive emotional engagement but mild frustration and cognitive fatigue suggesting need for balance improvements.

data.title: ARTHROSCOPIC LABRAL REPAIR AND SHOULDER STABILIZATION IN NATIONAL HOCKEY LEAGUE PLAYERS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH DECREASED PERFORMANCE IN THE FIRST YEAR OF RETURN TO PLAY WITH RETURN TO BASELINE IN THE SECOND YEAR
data.sub_theme: shoulder labral repair and stabilization, return to play
data.summary: Matched cohort analysis of 94 NHL players undergoing shoulder labral repair or stabilization found performance decreased in year one using advanced statistics (WAR/60) but returned to baseline by year two.

data.title: Das Incipit als Ort für Traum, Erinnerung und Introspektion in Welt- und Jugendliteratur. Didaktisch-methodische Überlegungen am Beispiel von Mikaël Olliviers "Le monde dans la main" (2011) und "Tout doit disparaître" (2007)
data.summary: Pedagogical analysis of literary incipit techniques in Mikaël Ollivier's youth novels examining dream sequences and introspection as teaching strategies for foreign language learning.

data.title: How Should We Report Sports Muscle Injuries? A Seven-Step Clinically Relevant Checklist
data.sub_theme: muscle injury imaging and reporting framework
data.summary: Seven-step structured reporting framework for sports muscle injuries using ultrasound and MRI emphasizes injury-to-imaging interval timing, pattern recognition, and return-to-play guidance across multiple sports.

data.title: The Development of Thai School Marching Band During the Reign of King Rama IX
data.summary: Musicological and historical study of Thai school marching band development from 1947-2016 tracing emergence, evolution, and competition trends across three distinct periods.

data.title: Middle East Conflicts & Their Influence on International Politics
data.summary: Correlation and regression analysis of Middle East regional conflicts demonstrating significant effects on international alignments, energy markets, migration crises, and great power competition dynamics.

data.title: Shockwave in the Management of ACL Injuries: A Clinical Perspective
data.sub_theme: ACL injury management, extracorporeal shockwave therapy
data.summary: Clinical perspective proposing extracorporeal shockwave therapy and radial pressure waves as non-invasive treatment options for ACL injury management to improve return to play and reduce post-traumatic osteoarthritis risk.

data.title: Pengaruh Asimetri Informasi, Manajemen Laba, Pengungkapan Sukarela dan Diversifikasi Bisnis terhadap Biaya Modal Ekuitas
data.journal: Jurnal Inovasi Ekonomi Syariah dan Akuntansi.
data.sub_theme: cost of equity capital in food and beverage companies
data.summary: Quantitative analysis of factors influencing cost of equity capital in Indonesian food and beverage manufacturing companies, finding earnings management and voluntary disclosure significantly affect equity costs.

data.title: Evaluating rehabilitation and return to play procedures in male professional football: A narrative review
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: rehabilitation, return-to-play procedures, decision-making frameworks
data.summary: Narrative review of rehabilitation and return-to-play procedures in male professional football, evaluating evidence-informed frameworks and criteria-based progressions to mitigate subsequent injury risk.

data.title: WHY BUSINESS TOOLS ARE ESSENTIAL FOR MANAGING A SPINE PROGRAMME
data.sub_theme: spine surgery program management, business tools, operational modeling
data.summary: Case study demonstrating use of business tools and operational modeling to advocate for spine program capacity expansion in Canada, achieving $4.1M annual savings and reducing surgical waitlists.

data.title: The Role of Diaspora Women in Peacebuilding: The Case of South Sudan Refugee Women in Eldoret, Kenya
data.journal: Africa journal of technical and vocational education and training.
data.sub_theme: peacebuilding, diaspora women, refugee communities
data.summary: Qualitative case study examining the role of South Sudanese refugee women in Eldoret, Kenya in peacebuilding efforts through economic empowerment, education, and cultural activities.

data.title: RESULTS OF COMBINED ALL-ARTHROSCOPIC LATARJET WITH HILL-SACHS REMPLISSAGE FOR SIGNIFICANT BIPOLAR GLENOHUMERAL BONE LOSS
data.sub_theme: shoulder surgery, arthroscopic Latarjet procedure, Hill-Sachs remplissage
data.summary: Prospective surgical case series reporting clinical and radiographic outcomes of combined arthroscopic Latarjet with Hill-Sachs remplissage for glenohumeral instability with significant bone loss.

data.title: “PE is basically about being active” – Students’ perspectives on media education in physical education
data.sub_theme: media literacy integration in physical education pedagogy
data.summary: Qualitative interviews with German upper secondary students revealed that while digital media in PE is used to support movement understanding and performance analysis, critical-reflective media education is rarely addressed, with students expressing concerns about reduced physical activity time and data privacy.

data.title: ANTERIOR CRUCIATE LIGAMENT RUPTURES IN NFL PLAYERS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH POSITION- AND TASK-SPECIFIC PERFORMANCE CHANGES
data.sub_theme: ACL rupture, return-to-sport, position-specific performance recovery
data.summary: Analysis of 205 NFL players who sustained ACL ruptures (2007-2022) using net expected points and tracking models revealed position-specific performance declines: running backs showed significant drops in yards per attempt and receiving NEP in postinjury year one; pass catchers declined in receiving yards/route metrics over two years.

data.title: Factors affecting the effectiveness of captive-bolt stunning of reindeer (Rangifer tarandus tarandus L.) at commercial slaughter in Sweden
data.sub_theme: animal welfare in slaughter, stunning effectiveness
data.summary: Analysis of 1,590 reindeer at two Swedish abattoirs shows that stunning operator experience significantly reduces stun-to-stick interval and improves captive-bolt stunning effectiveness, with mean interval of 44.1 seconds for effective stuns.

data.title: Analisis Pembelajaran Bahasa Indonesia di Sekolah Dasar
data.journal: Jurnal Insan Pendidikan dan Sosial Humaniora
data.sub_theme: Indonesian language education in elementary schools
data.summary: Conceptual analysis of Indonesian language learning in primary schools discusses pedagogical approaches, common learning difficulties, and strategies to improve student comprehension and communication skills.

data.title: Enhancing the adoption of soil conservation practices with targeted educational programs
data.sub_theme: soil conservation education programs
data.summary: Two educational programs in eastern Nebraska demonstrate that targeted conservation education reduces annual soil erosion by 2.5 Mt and 170,000 t respectively through adoption of reduced-tillage and terracing practices.

data.title: Energy Efficient Downlink mMIMO Using Dynamic Antenna and Power Adaptation
data.summary: Paper on 6G telecommunications systems using dynamic antenna and power adaptation for energy efficiency in massive MIMO networks; not related to sports.

data.title: S03-2: Challenges and Opportunities for the Co-Creation of Supportive Spatial Outdoor Conditions for HEPA
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: community participation in urban planning for physical activity
data.summary: The C3Places project used co-creation and digital tools to engage stakeholders in improving public outdoor spaces for health-enhancing physical activity through inclusive urban planning across four European cities.

data.title: Take the Stairs to Improve Your Fitness – A Project for Developing a Stair Test Mobile Application for Monitoring Fitness
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: aerobic fitness monitoring via mobile stair test application
data.summary: A mobile application was developed using artificial intelligence to monitor aerobic fitness levels through a simple stair test performed on public staircases, with pilot testing in Jyväskylä to evaluate fitness improvements and user engagement.

data.title: Feeling bad about progress does not lead people want to change their health behaviour
data.sub_theme: progress-related affect and health behavior change
data.summary: Cross-sectional and experimental studies found that feeling good rather than bad about progress in eating, exercise, and alcohol consumption was associated with stronger intentions to maintain healthy behaviors, challenging standard theoretical predictions.

data.title: Screening Mental, Social, and Health Readiness Among Prospective Brides and Grooms
data.sub_theme: health screening of prospective brides and grooms
data.summary: An observational study screened 30 prospective couples in Indonesia for mental, social, and health readiness prior to marriage, finding some prevalence of low upper arm circumference in women and elevated blood pressure in men.

data.title: Design Of A Digital Platform As An Effort To Empower Communities In The Tourism Sector Based On Local Wisdom
data.sub_theme: digital platform design for community tourism empowerment
data.summary: A Research and Development study using Design Thinking methodology created a community-based digital tourism platform in Indonesia to promote local businesses and cultural heritage while supporting sustainable development goals.

data.title: Toward a regional digital pathology network in Tuscany: current status and implementation roadmap
data.journal: Archiv für Pathologische Anatomie und Physiologie und für Klinische Medicin
data.sub_theme: digital pathology network implementation in healthcare
data.summary: A regional strategic roadmap for implementing digital pathology with AI-assisted tools and cloud infrastructure in Tuscany's healthcare system to improve diagnostic workflows and inter-institutional collaboration.

data.title: KL Sentral Personal Companion Service: A Practical City Guide
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: personal companion services in urban context
data.summary: An informational article describing personal companion services available in KL Sentral, Kuala Lumpur, focusing on lifestyle support for business travelers, tourists, and relocating professionals.

data.title: Attitudes toward Success and Failure
data.sub_theme: reference-dependent preferences and attitudes toward success and failure
data.summary: An economic theory paper examines how decision-makers' risk attitudes reverse across a success-failure threshold, unifying reference-dependent preference models through local comparative statics.

data.title: Penerapan Jaringan Saraf Tiruan untuk Memprediksi Jumlah TKW SBD di BP2MI dengan Pendekatan Algoritma Backropagation
data.sub_theme: predicting number of migrant workers via neural networks
data.summary: An artificial neural network with backpropagation algorithm was applied to predict the annual number of Indonesian migrant workers processed by BP2MI based on historical data and labor market factors.

data.title: Development of the ALLEGRO Noble Liquid Calorimeter for FCC-ee
data.summary: Particle physics calorimeter design for FCC-ee using noble liquid technology with multi-layer PCBs to achieve high granularity and energy resolution.

data.title: S16-1: Evaluating GOAL!: Integrating a Physical Activity and Lifestyle Intervention Into Outpatient Care for People With Severe Mental Illness
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: mental health intervention, physical activity
data.summary: Quasi-experimental evaluation of GOAL!, a multicomponent lifestyle intervention combining physical activity and nutrition coaching for people with severe mental illness, showing promising increases in PA after three months.

data.title: Implementing Sensor-Based Physical Activity Measurement in the Existing Infrastructure for the National Health Surveillance in The Netherlands
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: physical activity measurement, sensor technology, surveillance
data.summary: Pilot study implementing accelerometer-based physical activity measurement in Dutch national health surveillance infrastructure, analyzing participation barriers and facilitators across demographic groups.

data.title: Quantitative comparison of three-dimensional bodies using geometrical properties to validate the dissimilarity of a standard collection of 3D geomodels
data.summary: Methodology for quantifying 3D geological shapes using geometrical parameters and statistical analysis to validate structural dissimilarity and establish benchmark models.

data.title: KL Sentral Personal Companion Service: A Practical City Guide
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: Guide to personal companion services in Kuala Lumpur's KL Sentral transportation hub for business travelers and urban professionals.

data.title: Evaluating the Dutch Action Plan on Physical Activity From a Systems’ Perspective
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: physical activity policy evaluation, systems approach
data.summary: Interim evaluation of Dutch Action Plan on Physical Activity (2023-2025) using systems perspective, finding positive developments in awareness and cross-domain collaboration across healthcare, education, and workplace sectors.

data.title: How well can we quantify when 1.5 °C of global warming has been exceeded?
data.summary: Methodological overview of challenges and approaches for quantifying when 1.5°C global warming threshold has been exceeded relative to pre-industrial levels.

data.title: Coverage of Organic Farming Practices by Kenya’s Leading Newspapers
data.journal: Journal of research and academic writing.
data.summary: Content analysis of organic farming coverage in Kenya's leading newspapers (Daily Nation and The Standard), finding less than 25% dedicated coverage with majority being sponsored articles.

data.title: CHOICE D7.1 Project Website
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: Project deliverable report describing the CHOICE website design and functionality as a digital communication hub for climate-related research dissemination.

data.summary: Project deliverable report describing the CHOICE website design and functionality as a digital communication hub for climate-related research dissemination.

data.journal: Murray State's Digital Commons (Murray State University)

data.summary: This paper is about cybersecurity education in community colleges and is not related to sports.

data.title: Optimization of the provision process and training directions for national swimming teams
data.journal: Uchenye zapiski universiteta imeni P F Lesgafta
data.sub_theme: national team training support and optimization
data.summary: Analysis of support processes and training directions for national swimming teams (2000-2024) identifies risk factors and contradictions in competitive swimming training, yielding six recommendations for improving training effectiveness.

data.summary: This ethnographic grounded theory study examines moral and soul injury trauma in 11 former South African liberation activists, not sports-focused.

data.summary: This paper provides a framework for dependable industrial wireless communication networks (IWCNs) in 5G/6G with adaptive protocols and case studies, unrelated to sports.

data.summary: Paper proposes workflow engine architecture for business process automation in SMEs using Elsa Workflows and .NET platform.

data.summary: Paper develops Environmental Paper Industry Performance Indicator (EPIPI) for assessing environmental waste management in pulp and paper production.

data.summary: Paper presents design and thermo-mechanical modeling of automated cooking machine for smart food preparation systems.

data.summary: Descriptive-analytical study examining curriculum content in Bangladesh public schools for manifestations of intellectual invasion in civic education, social studies, and language textbooks.

data.title: Resilient-to-Fragile Transition and Excess Volatility in Supply Chain Networks
data.summary: Paper studies resilience-to-fragility transition in production networks through numerical simulations, showing how firms' inventory decisions drive systems toward criticality generating excess volatility.

data.title: Method-Comparison Validation of a Novel Capillary Blood Collection Kit, True Dose® TD-EPI, for Therapeutic Drug Monitoring of Epirubicin
data.summary: Method-comparison validation study of capillary blood collection kit for epirubicin therapeutic drug monitoring in breast cancer patients using LC-MS/MS.

data.summary: Quantum computing research on error-correcting codes with no relevance to sports.

data.summary: Astrophysics research on gravitational wave detection in binary neutron star mergers with no relevance to sports.

data.summary: Hospitality supply chain study on product bundle recommendations using purchase history analytics with no relevance to sports.

data.summary: Evolutionary game theory study on cooperation in deme-structured populations using prisoner's dilemma models with no relevance to sports.

data.title: Evaluating the Physiological Effects of Eccentric Exercises in Adults and Older Adults With Cardiovascular Disease: A Narrative Review
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: eccentric exercise rehabilitation in cardiovascular disease
data.summary: Narrative review of 13 studies shows eccentric exercise is safe and effective for cardiovascular disease patients, producing lower oxygen consumption and improved cardiac function compared to concentric training.

data.title: S14-1: Building an All-Island Interdisciplinary Consortium for Research on Women in Sport, Exercise, Physical Activity, and Health
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences

data.summary: Development of an all-island Irish research consortium (míde) to advance interdisciplinary research on women in sport, exercise, and physical activity, addressing underrepresentation of female athletes in sport science research.

data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)

data.summary: Theoretical framework for governance science addressing structural timing of refusal in irreversible systems; not related to sport.

data.title: S14-2: A Scoping Review of Research About Women in Sport: A Perspective From the Island of Ireland
data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences
data.sub_theme: scoping review of women in sport research Ireland
data.summary: Scoping review of 274 studies on women in sport in Ireland identified 86 injury studies, 72 performance studies, and 65 health/wellbeing studies, revealing dominance of cross-sectional quantitative designs and inconsistent sex/gender reporting.

data.title: Summary of the best evidence for early rehabilitation in ICU patients receiving continuous renal replacement therapy
data.sub_theme: early rehabilitation in ICU patients on dialysis
data.summary: Systematic review of 8 studies summarizing best evidence for early rehabilitation in ICU patients receiving continuous renal replacement therapy, covering multidisciplinary collaboration, assessment, and exercise strategies.

data.journal: Baltic Journal of Sport and Health Sciences

data.summary: Mapping study of eight international monitoring tools for national physical activity policies (WHO, EU frameworks) identified variations in data collection and policy process impacts through expert interviews and desk analysis.
