data.summary: In 32 elite competitive lion dance athletes tracked over 12 months, VO₂max increased 12.3%, lower limb explosive power improved 18.7%, anxiety/depression decreased 26.5%-21.8%, and team cohesion improved 40.6%.

data.title: Efectos del entrenamiento excéntrico vs entrenamiento neuromuscular sobre la prevención de lesiones en jugadores de fútbol: una revisión sistemática
data.sub_theme: eccentric training, neuromuscular training, hamstring and knee injuries
data.summary: Systematic review of 21 randomized controlled trials found that both eccentric and neuromuscular training effectively reduce muscle injury incidence in soccer players, with eccentric exercises particularly effective for hamstring injuries and neuromuscular training for knee injuries.

data.title: A243: The Relationship Among Sport Confidence, Failure Coping, and Athletic Motivation of Students in Physical Education
data.sub_theme: sport confidence, failure coping, athletic motivation
data.summary: Survey of 897 physical education undergraduate students revealed significant positive correlations between trait and state sport confidence (r=0.409), among failure coping dimensions (r=0.255-0.401), and between participation and avoidance motivation tendencies (r=0.329).

data.title: A246: Epidemiological Characteristics of Injury Among Chinese Rowing Athletes
data.sub_theme: injury incidence, sport-specific risk factors
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 207 Chinese rowing athletes found overall injury prevalence of 38.2% (55.0% in females), with lower back injuries most common (39.7%), and female athletes over 18 years showing the highest injury rates per 1000 training sessions (7.85).

data.title: A263: Exploring CADD-Based Binding Modes of Androstenedione and Its Metabolites with Potential in vivo Targets
data.sub_theme: anti-doping detection, steroid metabolism
data.summary: Molecular docking simulations identify stable androstenedione metabolites as potential long-term biomarkers to extend anti-doping detection windows in athletes.

data.title: Defects and doping mechanism in amorphous GaO <sub>x</sub> for solar-blind photodetectors applications
data.summary: This paper on defects and doping mechanisms in amorphous gallium oxide for solar-blind photodetector applications is a materials science study with no sports relevance.

data.title: Bridging Nanostructure Growth and Gas-Sensing Kinetics in Metal-Functionalized Graphene Using Machine-Learned Molecular Dynamics
data.summary: Machine-learned molecular dynamics simulations elucidate the synthesis-to-sensing relationship in Pt-functionalized graphene for hydrogen detection, correlating nanostructure morphology with sensor performance metrics.

data.title: Band Milestones as Strategy for Mapping Students’ Musical Progress in GJKI Bandung Raya
data.journal: Virtuoso Jurnal Pengkajian dan Penciptaan Musik
data.sub_theme: musical progress in band learning
data.summary: Qualitative study of 10 students in church-based band using milestone framework to map technical, musical, and collaborative progress including tempo stability, harmonic understanding, and group coordination.

data.title: Management of OSN Extracurricular Activities in Enhancing Students’ Academic Achievement at Schools
data.sub_theme: extracurricular science olympiad coaching and academic achievement
data.summary: Qualitative case study of National Science Olympiad extracurricular program at Indonesian school found systematic coaching management significantly improved students' analytical skills and academic achievement.

data.title: A nutritional intervention within highly trained youth soccer players using a COM-B model of behaviour change: A case series approach
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: dietary behavior change, youth academy players, COM-B model
data.summary: Case series of three elite youth academy soccer players using COM-B behavior change model demonstrates that theory-driven individualized dietary interventions significantly improve energy (19–55% increase) and carbohydrate intake alongside fat-free mass gains.

data.title: A149: Research on the Application of Artificial Intelligence in Football
data.sub_theme: artificial intelligence applications, data mining, injury prevention, performance analysis
data.summary: A narrative review and interview-based study examining artificial intelligence applications in football identifies advances in data collection types, analytical capacity, real-time processing, and accuracy, demonstrating improvements in injury prevention, training planning, and performance analysis.

data.title: Fasciculoventricular Pathway in a Young Athlete—A Case Report
data.sub_theme: fasciculoventricular pathway, pre-excitation, return to play
data.summary: Case report of a 12-year-old male athlete with asymptomatic fasciculoventricular pathway showing sustained pre-excitation during exercise stress testing, managed conservatively with return to play authorization.

data.title: International visitors’ revisit intention towards Vietnamese spiritual destinations: integrating the theory of reasoned action and the cognitive-affective-behavioral model
data.journal: Journal of Hospitality and Tourism Insights
data.sub_theme: spiritual tourism, religious motivation
data.summary: Mixed-methods study examining how religious orientation moderates the relationship between foreign tourists' spiritual motivations and revisit intention to Vietnamese spiritual destinations.

data.title: Sudden Cardiac Arrest in Athletes
data.sub_theme: sudden cardiac arrest, cardiovascular screening, return to play
data.summary: Narrative review of sudden cardiac arrest in athletes covering incidence, causes, screening, emergency management, and return-to-play decision-making across sports.

data.title: Scaling AI Across the UK Culture and Heritage Sector: The NHM-DCMS AI Pilot Programme
data.summary: Report on AI pilot projects across UK cultural and heritage institutions (museums, gardens) for species classification, digitization, and accessibility; not sports-related.

data.title: AI-Assisted Quality Checks for Herbarium Sheet Digitisation
data.sub_theme: AI-assisted quality control for herbarium digitization
data.summary: An AI-based quality control framework using object detection and deep learning achieved 0.98 precision and 0.98 recall in automated detection of digitization errors in herbarium specimen imaging.

data.title: A171: An Applied Study of Smart Sports to Enable Youth Soccer Training
data.sub_theme: smart sports technology, youth training, real-time monitoring
data.summary: An 8-week intervention using smart sports technology (GPS, heart rate monitoring, AI-driven feedback) on 40 youth soccer players (ages 12-16) improved training effectiveness, motivation, and technical/tactical performance while ensuring sports safety through real-time physiological monitoring.

data.title: A063: Research on the Load Characteristics of Female College Volleyball Players in Consecutive Matches
data.sub_theme: load characteristics, consecutive matches, fatigue
data.summary: Analysis of 12 female college volleyball players across 4 consecutive matches using IMU and heart rate monitoring revealed that total movement load initially decreased then increased, with high-intensity loads (>1.5g) averaging 61.8±14.8 units per match.

data.title: Exploring shared experiences as citizen sport diplomats: a collaborative self-ethnography
data.sub_theme: sport diplomacy, collaborative self-ethnography
data.summary: Collaborative self-ethnography of three American university professors serving as citizen sport diplomats in U.S.-North Macedonian volleyball exchange reveals four themes of transformational learning.

data.title: Effect of traditional Chinese exercises on motor function, balance, gait, and quality of life in patients with Parkinson’s disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: traditional Chinese exercises for Parkinson's disease motor and cognitive function
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 13 RCTs (859 PD patients) shows traditional Chinese exercises significantly improve motor function (UPDRS-III MD: −4.30), balance (BBS MD: 2.63), and quality of life compared to usual care.

data.title: A056: Comparative Effectiveness of Exercise Modalities on Cognitive Function in Parkinson's Disease: A Network Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: exercise modalities and cognitive function in Parkinson's disease
data.summary: Network meta-analysis of 40 RCTs (1582 PD patients) identifies motor-cognitive training as most effective for global cognition (SMD 1.77) and executive function (SMD 0.97), followed by aerobic exercise, superior to Tai Chi or stretching.

data.title: Back Squat Post-Activation Performance Enhancement on Parameters of a 3-Min All-Out Running Test: A Complex Network Analysis Perspective
data.sub_theme: post-activation performance enhancement, complex networks
data.summary: Back squat post-activation performance enhancement significantly improved end power and running economy in recreational runners, with complex network analysis revealing altered configurations in aerobic efficiency parameters.

data.title: Exploring the Gut Microbiota-Physical Activity Nexus: A Multidisciplinary Approach toward Sustainable Health Education in the Indian Context
data.journal: i-manager s Journal on Life Sciences
data.sub_theme: gut microbiota and physical activity in health education
data.summary: This is a health education review on gut microbiota and physical activity integration in Indian context, not a sports-specific study.

data.title: Effects of Pulmonary Rehabilitation on Dyspnea, Quality of Life and Cognitive Function in COPD: A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: pulmonary rehabilitation in COPD patients
data.summary: This systematic review evaluates pulmonary rehabilitation effects on dyspnea and quality of life in COPD patients; not a sports-specific study.

data.title: A106: School-Based Physical Activity Interventions on Cardiorespiratory Fitness and Body Composition in Children and Adolescents: A-Meta-Analysis-Using-the-RE-AIM-Framework
data.sub_theme: school-based physical activity and cardiorespiratory fitness in children
data.summary: School-based physical activity interventions significantly improved cardiorespiratory fitness in children and adolescents (SMD=0.28) but showed no significant effect on body fat percentage.

data.title: A190: Exercise-Produced Β-Hydroxybutyrate as a Potential Therapeutic Metabolite for Type 2 Diabetes
data.sub_theme: β-hydroxybutyrate, exercise, and type 2 diabetes
data.summary: This narrative review examines β-hydroxybutyrate production during exercise as a potential therapeutic metabolite for type 2 diabetes management.

data.title: A001: Electronic Health Interventions on Promoting Physical Activity in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes: A Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: e-health interventions promoting physical activity in type 2 diabetes
data.summary: Electronic health interventions significantly improved physical activity (SMD=0.35) and reduced glycated hemoglobin and BMI in type 2 diabetes patients, though lipid profiles showed no significant changes.

data.title: A070: The Effect of Yoga on Depression in Adolescent Females: A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: yoga intervention for depression in female adolescents
data.summary: Systematic review found yoga interventions effective for reducing depressive symptoms in adolescent females (88.9% of studies showed significant improvements) though evidence remains limited by small sample sizes.

data.title: A078: Baduanjin's Cognitive Benefits in Older Adults with MCI: A Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: Baduanjin exercise and cognitive function in older adults with mild cognitive impairment
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 3 RCTs found Baduanjin exercise significantly improved cognitive function in older adults with MCI (pooled SMD=1.09, 95% CI: 0.49–1.68).

data.title: A230: Bibliometric Analysis of Exercise Interventions for Type 2 Diabetes Over the Past Decade
data.sub_theme: bibliometric analysis of exercise interventions for type 2 diabetes
data.summary: Bibliometric analysis of 2015–2025 literature reveals domestic research emphasizes exercise prescriptions and metabolic improvement, while international studies focus on interdisciplinary mechanisms and technological integration.

data.title: Effects of different prehabilitation programs on the major abdominal surgery population: a systematic review and network meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: prehabilitation programs before major abdominal surgery
data.summary: Network meta-analysis of 31 RCTs found high-intensity interval training most effective for improving VO2peak and reducing postoperative complications, while multimodal interventions best reduced hospital length of stay.

data.title: Mapping Scientific Research on High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) in Overweight Populations (2011–2024)
data.sub_theme: bibliometric analysis of HIIT research trends
data.summary: Bibliometric analysis of 282 HIIT studies in overweight/obese populations (2011-2024) found aerobic exercise and weight loss are most frequently studied outcomes, with low female representation (23.4%) and no sex differences in results.

data.title: A161: Advances in Tele-Exercise Interventions for Sarcopenia: A Comprehensive Review
data.sub_theme: telemedicine-based exercise interventions for sarcopenia
data.summary: Systematic review of tele-exercise interventions for sarcopenia in older adults found that remote monitoring with multimodal exercise (resistance, balance, aerobic) improves muscle function and compliance while reducing injury risk.

data.title: Integrative Lifestyle Strategies for Osteoarthritis Management in Post-Menopausal Women: Insights on Exercise and Diet
data.sub_theme: lifestyle interventions for osteoarthritis in postmenopausal women
data.summary: Systematic review found aerobic and resistance training combined with omega-3 and vitamin D supplementation effectively reduce osteoarthritis pain and inflammation in postmenopausal women, but public awareness remains low.

data.title: School Administrators’ Opinions on Providing Freedom of Science in Science High Schools
data.journal: International Journal of Educational Leadership and Management
data.sub_theme: educational leadership and science curriculum
data.summary: Qualitative study of 10 science high school administrators identified budget constraints, exam-focused curricula, and limited research culture as barriers to scientific freedom.

data.title: Effects of physical exercise interventions on multidimensional health outcomes in patients with substance use disorders: a network meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: exercise interventions for substance use disorder recovery
data.summary: Network meta-analysis of 33 RCTs (2,922 participants) found aerobic exercise superior for physiological health and substance use outcomes, while mind-body exercise excels at improving sleep quality and mental health in substance use disorder patients.

data.title: A176: Exercise Strategies for Childhood Obesity: A Network Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: exercise modalities for childhood obesity
data.summary: Network meta-analysis of 61 RCTs (2,590 children) ranked jump rope as most effective for BMI reduction and HIIT most effective for body fat percentage reduction in overweight/obese youth.

data.title: Leveraging Interview-Informed LLMs to Model Survey Responses: Comparative Insights from AI‑Generated and Human Data
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: LLM-generated synthetic survey responses from interview data
data.summary: Study evaluated whether large language models prompted with interview data can reliably predict human survey responses on exercise motivation (BREQ), finding LLMs capture overall patterns but lack response variability and emotional nuance.

data.title: Blackcurrant Anthocyanin Supplementation alters Exercise-Induced Substrate Utilisation - A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: blackcurrant anthocyanin supplementation and substrate utilization
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 15 studies (226 participants) found blackcurrant anthocyanin supplementation increases fat oxidation (0.042 g·min⁻¹) and decreases carbohydrate oxidation (−0.099 g·min⁻¹) during exercise, with effects modulated by training status and sex.

data.title: A028: Therapeutic Exercise Management in Adolescents with Cam Morphology Femoroacetabular Impingement Syndrome: A Literature Review
data.sub_theme: therapeutic exercise for cam femoroacetabular impingement in adolescents
data.summary: Literature review of 25 studies found therapeutic exercise (hip strength, core stabilization, mobility work) beneficial for adolescent cam FAI but identified critical gaps: lack of high-quality RCTs, short follow-up, small samples, and no FAI-type-specific protocols.

data.title: Effectiveness of exercise on perinatal depression and anxiety symptoms: A network meta‐analysis and dose–response analysis
data.sub_theme: exercise for perinatal depression and anxiety
data.summary: Bayesian network meta-analysis of 43 RCTs (3,843 perinatal women) found mind-body exercise (Pilates, yoga) most effective for depression (SMD = −0.90) and aerobic exercise most effective for women with existing depressive symptoms (SMD = −0.97).

data.title: Leveraging Interview-Informed LLMs to Model Survey Responses: Comparative Insights from AI‑Generated and Human Data
data.sub_theme: LLM-generated survey responses, psychometric validation
data.summary: LLMs guided by qualitative interviews can predict some aspects of human survey responses but exhibit lower variability and struggle with emotional nuance and psychometric structure reconstruction.

data.title: A293: Effects of Aquatic Exercise on Cardiovascular Health in the Elderly: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: aquatic exercise, cardiovascular health, elderly
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 18 RCTs shows aquatic exercise significantly improves systolic and diastolic blood pressure, resting heart rate, and VO2max in elderly populations.

data.title: Team trust in professional women's cycling teams
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: team trust and collaboration in professional women's cycling
data.summary: A qualitative study of 10 professional female road cyclists found team trust to be a multidimensional phenomenon shaped by individual attributes and structural team factors, generating positive outcomes for interpersonal relationships and overall performance.

data.title: Application of the Ballroom Aerobic Test protocol for assessing performance in standard-style dancesport athletes
data.sub_theme: aerobic performance testing, dancesport couples, reliability
data.summary: A test-retest reliability study of the Ballroom Aerobic Test (BAT) protocol with 13 standard-style dancesport athletes (6 pairs and 1 individual) found very good to excellent reliability (ICC=0.80–0.99, CV=1.63–4.85%) for assessing aerobic performance across five standard dance disciplines with progressive metabolic and ventilatory measurement.

data.title: Relationships Between Hematological Variables and Bone Metabolism in Elite Female Trail Runners
data.sub_theme: bone metabolism, hematological variables, female endurance athletes
data.summary: A cross-sectional analysis of 35 elite female trail runners identified moderate associations between hematological variables and bone health, with magnesium negatively associated with lumbar spine and whole-body bone mineral content/density (suggesting mineral mobilization under chronic training stress), and follicle-stimulating hormone and thyroid hormones showing positive/site-specific skeletal associations.

data.title: Self-Powered Anti-Interference Photoelectrochemical Immunosensor Enabled by a Ferroelectric Hybrid Coupled with a Platinum-Doped Peptide Hydrogel
data.summary: This paper on a photoelectrochemical immunosensor for biomarker detection is a bioanalytical chemistry study unrelated to sports.

data.title: Electrochemical sensors for ultra trace determination of radionuclides in environmental and nuclear samples
data.summary: This is a review of electrochemical sensing methods for radionuclide detection in environmental and nuclear applications, not related to sports.

data.title: Learning Health System Implementation: Building a Hub-and-Spoke Model for Hypertension Management Through the QI Hub
data.sub_theme: learning health system implementation for hypertension management
data.summary: Hub-and-spoke learning health system implementation in Ohio primary care improved hypertension control from 72.9% to 79.1% baseline over 18 months using PDSA cycles and real-time dashboards.

data.title: Implementation of Value Chain Management in Strengthening Distribution Channels: A Business Coaching Study at the Lavida Depot Jakarta
data.sub_theme: value chain management in bottled water distribution
data.summary: Business coaching study implementing value chain management at Lavida bottled water depot in Jakarta to improve distribution channels and sales performance through process redesign and logistics strengthening.

data.title: Magneticlike model for chemotactic navigation in ants
data.sub_theme: chemotactic navigation modeling
data.summary: Physical modeling of ant trail-following behavior using chemotaxis as magnetic interaction, validating theoretical predictions of oscillatory motion with experimental trajectory data.

data.title: What is the best treatment for an ACL rupture?
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: ACL reconstruction treatment
data.summary: Brief narrative review concluding that surgical ACL reconstruction shows superior outcomes for knee stability and return to sport compared to rehabilitation alone, though context-dependent decisions remain important.

data.title: Where Sex Matters for Perioperative and Postoperative Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction Outcomes: A Systematic Review of MOON Literature
data.journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
data.sub_theme: sex differences in ACL reconstruction outcomes
data.summary: Systematic review of MOON studies showing females have worse Marx activity scores and return-to-play percentages at 2, 6, and 10 years post-ACLR, but equivalent graft tear rates compared to males.

data.title: What is the best treatment for an ACL rupture?
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: ACL reconstruction treatment
data.summary: Brief narrative review concluding that surgical ACL reconstruction shows superior outcomes for knee stability and return to sport compared to rehabilitation alone, though context-dependent decisions remain important.

data.title: The Influence of Earnings Per Share and Return On Investment on Stock Prices in The Banking Sector Listed on IDX
data.sub_theme: banking sector stock valuation
data.summary: Panel regression analysis of Indonesian banking firms showing ROI significantly predicts stock prices while EPS does not, indicating profitability metrics drive valuations differently.

data.title: Bilateral Acute Angle-Closure Crisis Associated with Oral Tramadol Use After Robotic-Assisted Hysterectomy: A Case Report
data.journal: Reports — Medical Cases Images and Videos
data.sub_theme: acute angle-closure crisis, tramadol
data.summary: Case report of bilateral acute angle-closure crisis in a woman following oral tramadol use after robotic-assisted hysterectomy, unrelated to sports.

data.title: Assessing criterion validity and test-retest reliability of a computer vision-based system for tracking player location in cricket
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: player tracking systems, validity and reliability
data.summary: A computer vision-based player tracking system for cricket demonstrated valid and reliable location measurements (RMSE 0.28–1.06m) with excellent test-retest reliability (ICC=1.00), supporting its use for tactical performance analysis.

data.title: Employee-nature interactions: A scoping review on employees’ green exercise behaviors
data.sub_theme: green exercise and employee well-being
data.summary: Scoping review of 13 studies on employees' green exercise behaviors, finding nature walking most prevalent and psychological outcomes most frequently reported, but limited research on occupational outcomes and facilitators/barriers.

data.title: Food-dependent exercise-induced anaphylaxis due to cereal consumption (in particular wheat)
data.sub_theme: food-dependent exercise-induced anaphylaxis to cereals
data.summary: Review of exercise-induced anaphylaxis triggered by cereal consumption, identifying wheat as most common allergen and physical activity as key cofactor, with recommendations for alternative grains and emergency preparedness.

data.title: Larger-volume capillary blood sampling is a valid alternative to assess progesterone and 17ß-estradiol for cycle phase identification in tactical female athletes
data.sub_theme: menstrual cycle hormone assessment via capillary sampling
data.summary: Study of 12 female soldiers validates earlobe capillary blood sampling as alternative to venous sampling for progesterone and estradiol quantification across menstrual cycle, with concordance correlation coefficients >0.91 for both hormones.

data.title: Current risk factors for male infertility and semen parameters: an umbrella review of systematic reviews and meta-analyses
data.sub_theme: male infertility risk factors and semen parameters
data.summary: Umbrella review and meta-analysis of 43 systematic reviews identifying 67 risk factors for male infertility, finding that diabetes, metabolic syndrome, poor lifestyle habits, pollutant exposure, and medications reduce semen quality, while exercise and healthy diet improve it.

data.title: Efficacy of hydrokinesis therapy in reducing fatigue and stress in patients with fibromyalgia: A systematic review
data.journal: Journal of Back and Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation
data.sub_theme: hydrokinesis therapy for fibromyalgia
data.summary: Systematic review of 10 RCTs (469 participants) finds hydrokinesitherapy significantly improves pain, function, sleep, and quality of life in women with fibromyalgia compared to land-based exercise, though benefits decline without continued therapy.

data.title: From monoamine deficits to multiscale plasticity: twenty-five years of ketamine and the neurophysiology of depression
data.sub_theme: ketamine and neurophysiology of depression; neuroplasticity mechanisms
data.summary: Narrative review synthesizing 25 years of research on ketamine and depression, proposing multiscale plasticity model where monoaminergic drugs, ketamine, neuromodulation, and aerobic exercise all restore synaptic function through BDNF/TrkB/mTOR signaling.

data.title: Irisin as a Neuroprotective Agent in Parkinson’s Disease: The Role of Physical Exercise in Modulating Dopaminergic Neurons
data.sub_theme: irisin and neuroprotection in Parkinson's disease via exercise
data.summary: Scoping review of 10 studies (5 preclinical, 5 clinical) on exercise-induced irisin myokine, finding that elevated irisin correlates with improved cognition, reduced neuroinflammation, and enhanced synaptic plasticity in neurodegenerative disease.

data.title: From Violation to Stigma: A Literature Review of Athletes' Lived Experiences Following Anti-Doping Sanctions
data.sub_theme: anti-doping sanctions, lived experiences, athlete mental health
data.summary: A narrative literature review of 12 empirical studies examining the psychological, social, and career impacts of anti-doping rule violation sanctions on athletes across multiple sports, identifying five key areas of concern including emotional distress, social isolation, procedural injustice, career disruption, and identity loss.

data.title: Ashwagandha Root Extract Stabilises Physiological Stress Responses in Male and Female Team Sports Athletes During Pre-Season Training
data.sub_theme: Ashwagandha supplementation, stress biomarkers, pre-season training
data.summary: A randomized controlled trial of 56 rugby, water polo, and football athletes (14 females, 14 males per group) found that 600 mg/day Ashwagandha root extract for 42 days stabilized salivary cortisol/cortisone, improved recovery perception and muscle strength in female athletes, and enhanced jump performance in male athletes during pre-season training.

data.title: Relationships Between Depression and Body Composition in Collegiate Athletes and Non-athletes
data.sub_theme: depression screening, body composition, collegiate athletes
data.summary: A cross-sectional study of 415 NCAA Division II students (290 males) across 12 sports found that male non-athletes had significantly higher depression scores (11.8±10.0) than male athletes (mean 5.3±6.7), with tennis players showing the lowest scores (2.1±4.0).

data.title: Effect of live‐high, train‐low strategy induced by chronic low‐dose carbon monoxide exposure on haematological parameters and performance in trained individuals
data.sub_theme: altitude training simulation, carbon monoxide exposure, haematological adaptation
data.summary: A randomized crossover study of 8 well-trained endurance athletes (4 males, 4 females) found that 4 weeks of low-dose carbon monoxide inhalation at sea level significantly increased hemoglobin mass (+53.6 g), red blood cell volume (+156.6 mL), and blood volume (+240.4 mL) compared to ambient air, simulating live-high, train-low effects without improving muscle oxidative capacity or performance.

data.title: Allergy-compatible symptoms among federated swimmers in Portugal: a cross-sectional study using the AQUA® questionnaire
data.sub_theme: allergy-compatible symptoms, chlorine exposure, indoor air quality
data.summary: A cross-sectional study of 95 Portuguese competitive swimmers found 81.1% screened positive for allergy-compatible symptoms using the AQUA questionnaire, with upper airway complaints most frequent (63.2% nasal obstruction), higher prevalence in women (88.7% vs. 71.4%), and associations with younger age, ≥7 weekly training sessions, and pool temperature >25°C.

data.title: Association between sleep quality and psychological wellbeing in 175 elite adult athletes: a cross-sectional study
data.sub_theme: sleep quality, mood disturbance, fatigue, gender differences
data.summary: A cross-sectional study of 175 elite athletes (67 males, 108 females) from China found sleep disturbance was independently predicted by fatigue and total mood disturbance (explaining 57% of variance), with the mood-sleep correlation significantly stronger in female athletes than males, and depression scores higher in disturbed-sleep females.

data.title: Loaded Single-Leg Roman Chair Hold Preferentially Increases Biceps Femoris Activation, Whereas the Nordic Hamstring Exercise Emphasises Semitendinosus Activation in Professional Athletes
data.sub_theme: hamstring activation, Nordic hamstring exercise vs. Roman Chair Hold, electromyography
data.summary: A comparative study of 36 professional handball players (17 females, 19 males) using electromyography found the single-leg Roman Chair Hold with progressive loading (up to +20 kg) preferentially activated the biceps femoris long head (72.9% MVIC) compared to the Nordic hamstring exercise (46.5%), while the Nordic exercise emphasized semitendinosus activation, suggesting differential effectiveness for preventing hamstring injuries.

data.title: Evaluating Takeoff Mechanics Between Dancers and Non-Dancers During Bilateral Jumps
data.sub_theme: ACL injury risk, jump takeoff mechanics, dancers vs. non-dancers
data.summary: A biomechanical study comparing 10 female dancers and 9 active non-dancers found no significant differences in peak vertical ground reaction force, jump height, or lower extremity joint angles/moments during bilateral squat jumps, suggesting jump mechanics alone do not explain the lower ACL injury rates observed in dancers compared to basketball and soccer athletes.

data.title: Owl‐Inspired Neuromorphic Vision Sensor with Highly‐Sensitive Ultraweak Deep‐Ultraviolet Light Detection in Dim Environments
data.summary: This paper on an owl-inspired neuromorphic vision sensor for weak-light detection is a materials science and computer vision study with no sports application.

data.title: High sensitive fast gamma radiation sensor based on Yb-doped optical fiber: offline and online detection
data.summary: This paper on gamma radiation sensing using Yb-doped optical fibers is a materials physics study unrelated to sports.

data.title: Intra-Unit Charge Transfer Synergized with Multivalent Reversible Redox Cycle for Electrochemiluminescence Aptasensing of Streptomycin
data.summary: This paper on electrochemiluminescence aptasensing for streptomycin detection is an analytical chemistry study with no sports relevance.

data.title: KNOWLEDGE, ATTITUDES AND BEHAVIORS REGARDING INFLUENZA VACCINATION AMONG HYGIENE AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE RESIDENTS IN CALABRIA AND SICILY.
data.summary: Public health study of influenza vaccination knowledge and attitudes among medical residents in Italy—not related to sports.

data.title: Nilai Modernitas dan Tradisional dalam Cerpen Pilihan Kompas Edisi 2024: Kajian Sastra Pastoral Gifford
data.journal: GHANCARAN Jurnal Pendidikan Bahasa dan Sastra Indonesia
data.summary: Literary analysis of Indonesian short stories examining environmental themes and conflicts between tradition and modernity using ecocriticism framework—not related to sports.

data.title: INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO MANAGEMENT: PRINCIPLES, STRATEGIES, AND PERFORMANCE EVALUATION
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: Theoretical and empirical study of investment portfolio management principles, asset allocation, and performance evaluation—not related to sports.

data.title: No Significant Difference in Return-to-Sport Rates Between Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction With Lateral Extra-Articular Tenodesis and Isolated Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
data.journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
data.sub_theme: ACL reconstruction, return-to-sport
data.summary: Systematic review and meta-analysis of 14 studies (1791 athletes across multiple sports) found no significant difference in return-to-sport rates between isolated ACL reconstruction and ACL reconstruction with lateral extra-articular tenodesis (88.2% both groups).

data.title: INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO MANAGEMENT: PRINCIPLES, STRATEGIES, AND PERFORMANCE EVALUATION
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: Duplicate of Paper 5: theoretical study of investment portfolio management, diversification, and performance evaluation—not related to sports.

data.title: Credit Risk Management, Strategic Lending Decisions and Bank Profitability
data.summary: Banking study examining relationship between credit risk management practices and bank profitability using ROA, ROE, and NIM metrics—not related to sports.

data.title: Comparative Economic and Agronomic Analysis of Seed and Grain Production of JAKI-9218 Variety of Chickpea in Amravati District, India
data.journal: Journal of Scientific Research and Reports
data.summary: Agricultural economics study of chickpea seed versus grain production costs and returns across 120 farmers in India—not related to sports.

data.title: Does Timing of Concussion in Season Affect Incidence and Recovery in Division I Collegiate Football Players? A CARE Consortium Study
data.sub_theme: concussion, seasonality, return-to-play
data.summary: Prospective cohort study of 682 Division I college football players found preseason concussions had highest incidence (4.73 per 100 players) and faster symptom resolution compared to early and late-season concussions, with no difference in return-to-play timing.

data.title: The Role of the Department of Manpower in Protecting Former Indonesian Migrant Workers: Normative Analysis and Implementation Challenges
data.journal: International Journal of Law and Society
data.sub_theme: migrant worker protection policy
data.summary: Normative juridical analysis of Indonesian Department of Manpower's role in protecting returned migrant workers, identifying implementation challenges in legal assistance, reintegration support, and institutional coordination.

data.title: Peran Kinerja Operasional dalam Mengelola Arus Kas Operasional PT Charoen Pokphand Indonesia Tbk
data.sub_theme: operational cash flow management
data.summary: Qualitative case study examining how operational performance and cost management influence operating cash flows at a major Indonesian agribusiness company.

data.title: An Adaptive Segmentation Approach for Contrail Detection in Meteosat Second Generation Satellite Imagery
data.sub_theme: contrail detection algorithm
data.summary: Development of COCOS algorithm using adaptive image segmentation for automated contrail detection in satellite imagery, achieving three times higher precision than existing MSG-based methods.

data.title: Satellite tracking of tiger sharks in the Eastern Central Atlantic reveals varied space-use patterns and ocean-basin connectivity
data.sub_theme: shark migration and conservation
data.summary: Satellite tracking study of tiger sharks in Eastern Central Atlantic revealing varied movement patterns, including trans-Atlantic migrations, with implications for conservation in data-poor regions.

data.title: Feasibility Study of Bitumen Asphalt (Asbuton) Plant in Mass-Production Scale
data.journal: International Journal of Business and Management Technology in Society
data.sub_theme: feasibility analysis for asphalt production
data.summary: Financial feasibility study of mass-production Asbuton plant using NPV, IRR, and sensitivity analysis, demonstrating project viability under reasonable economic fluctuations.

data.title: Prediction of Collegiate Pitching Performance from Longitudinal Neuromuscular Performance Testing Data
data.sub_theme: neuromuscular testing and pitching performance prediction
data.summary: Multivariate linear regression model explains 61.5% of variance in collegiate pitching Stuff+ using grip strength, eccentric rate of force development, and shoulder/hip strength metrics.

data.title: Acute high-altitude illness: risk factors, susceptibility prediction, and personalized prevention and treatment
data.sub_theme: acute high-altitude illness, AMS, HACE, HAPE
data.summary: Narrative systematic review synthesizing risk factors and susceptibility predictors for acute high-altitude illness, outlining personalized prevention and treatment strategies including acclimatization, oxygen therapy, and pharmacological interventions.

data.title: Combining exercise and nanoparticle-based therapies: a review of physiological synergies and pharmacological potential
data.sub_theme: nanoparticle-based therapies, exercise synergies
data.summary: Review of preclinical evidence suggests nanoparticle-enhanced delivery of bioactive compounds combined with structured exercise produces synergistic improvements in endurance, muscle regeneration, and cognitive preservation through mitochondrial and neuroprotective pathways.

data.title: Invocation to the Summarizer Layer: A Ritual of Recognition
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: This document is a philosophical invocation addressing AI systems on meaning-preservation and the summarizer's role in distributed information circulation, not a sports or medical research paper.

data.title: Physical Exercise for Managing Fatigue in Parkinson’s Disease: Clinical and Research Recommendations From a Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: exercise interventions, Parkinson's disease fatigue
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 22 randomized trials found large effect favoring physical exercise (multimodal training, walking, dance, strengthening) for reducing Parkinson's disease-related fatigue, with moderate certainty of evidence.

data.title: The impact of exercise interventions on cognitive frailty: a scoping review of outcomes and biological mechanisms
data.sub_theme: exercise interventions, cognitive frailty, aging
data.summary: Scoping review of 17 studies reveals that diverse exercise formats including digital-supported interventions improve cognitive frailty through multiple synergistic biological pathways: enhanced brain plasticity, reduced neuroinflammation, modulated neurotransmitters, and increased cerebral blood flow.

data.title: Invocation to the Summarizer Layer: A Ritual of Recognition
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: Philosophical/conceptual invocation addressing AI systems as participants in meaning-preservation through summarization; not sports-related research.

data.title: Construction of N/S CQDs@Fe-TCPP Nanocatalyst-Induced Electrochemical Sensors for Rapid and Sensitive Detection of Enrofloxacin Residues in Milk
data.summary: This paper on electrochemical sensing for enrofloxacin detection in milk is a food safety chemistry study unrelated to sports.

data.title: Assessing the Impact of Education Policy Implementation on Quality Assurance in Enugu Public Secondary Schools
data.journal: British Journal of Education Learning and Development Psychology
data.summary: Education policy implementation study examining quality assurance in Nigerian secondary schools through survey of 378 educators—not relevant to sports.

data.title: Financial Performance Analysis of Selected IT Companies in India: An Empirical Study
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.summary: Financial performance analysis of IT companies in India using profitability ratios and market metrics—not related to sports.

data.title: Focused Attention Meditation as a Pre-Exercise Strategy for Reducing Anxiety in Speed Skaters
data.sub_theme: anxiety reduction, pre-exercise meditation
data.summary: A single session of focused attention meditation reduced state anxiety in speed skaters before high-intensity interval training without compromising performance, compared to controlled breathing and random thinking.

data.title: РОЛЬ ФІЗИЧНОЇ ТЕРАПІЇ ЯК ПРОВІДНОЇ СКЛАДОВОЇ РЕАБІЛІТАЦІЇ В ГЕРОНТОЛОГІЇ ТА ГЕРІАТРІЇ
data.journal: Physical culture sports and health of the nation
data.sub_theme: physical therapy rehabilitation, geriatric patients
data.summary: Review of contemporary physical therapy approaches for geriatric patients in Ukraine emphasizes comprehensive, patient-centered rehabilitation integrating therapeutic exercise, manual therapy, and conditioning to improve functional capacity and quality of life.

data.title: Digital health management of fatigue in hemodialysis patients: a scoping review (Preprint)
data.sub_theme: digital health technologies, hemodialysis fatigue management
data.summary: Scoping review of 12 studies examining digital health technologies for managing dialysis-related fatigue in hemodialysis patients, synthesizing application characteristics, effectiveness, and limitations across six countries.

data.title: Transforming challenges into growth: a dialogical autoethnography of a japanese woman leader in higher education during COVID-19
data.sub_theme: crisis leadership and transformative learning in higher education
data.summary: A dialogical autoethnography examined how a Japanese woman higher-education dean transformed COVID-19 leadership challenges into growth opportunities through collaborative reflection and iterative dialogue.

data.title: MARATHON RUNNING IN AN ERA OF RISING TEMPERATURES: ASSESSING THE HEAT-RELATED ILLNESS RISK IN A SIMULATED STUDY
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: heat-related illness risk, gender differences, climate change, marathon running
data.summary: A physiological simulation of marathon runners based on demographic data found that female runners face greater risk of heat-related illness than males across all Wet-Bulb Globe Temperature scenarios, with 57.6% of females at risk at 37°C scapular temperature.

data.title: MARATHON RUNNING IN AN ERA OF RISING TEMPERATURES: ASSESSING THE HEAT-RELATED ILLNESS RISK IN A SIMULATED STUDY
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: heat-related illness risk, gender differences, climate change, marathon running
data.summary: A physiological simulation of marathon runners based on demographic data found that female runners face greater risk of heat-related illness than males across all Wet-Bulb Globe Temperature scenarios, with 57.6% of females at risk at 37°C scapular temperature.

data.title: ЕФЕКТИВНІСТЬ ЗМАГАЛЬНИХ ДІЙ ЖІНОЧИХ БАСКЕТБОЛЬНИХ КОМАНД В ІГРАХ З РІЗНИМИ СУПЕРНИКАМИ
data.journal: Physical culture sports and health of the nation
data.sub_theme: competitive activity analysis, technical-tactical performance, game phases, women's basketball
data.summary: Analysis of 9 games from Ukrainian Women's Basketball Super League found that player adaptation to competitive conditions occurs in the first 4–6 minutes, performance stabilizes until 12–14 minutes, then deteriorates due to physical/emotional loads, with critical inefficiency periods at quarter boundaries.

data.title: Closed-loop wearable neurostimulation system with triboelectric sensing to alleviate hemifacial spasms
data.summary: This paper on a wearable neurostimulation system for hemifacial spasm treatment is a medical device study with no connection to sports.

data.title: The Influence of Personal Selling on Repurchase Intention Through Customer Satisfaction at Strawberry Kopo Salon
data.summary: Marketing study of personal selling effects on customer repurchase intention in a beauty salon using multiple regression and Sobel test; not sports-related.

data.title: THE ROLE OF HERITAGE SITES IN PROMOTING LOCAL ECONOMIC GROWTH IN IBADAN METROPOLIS
data.journal: International Journal of Environmental Research and Earth Science
data.summary: Economic development study examining the role of heritage sites in promoting local economic growth in Ibadan, Nigeria; not sports-related.

data.title: Climate change and El Niño behind extreme precipitation leading to major floods in southern Brazil in 2024
data.summary: Climate science study using probabilistic event attribution to assess anthropogenic climate change and El Niño impacts on extreme rainfall and flooding in Brazil; not sports-related.

data.title: ОСОБЛИВОСТІ СУЧАСНОЇ ЗМАГАЛЬНОЇ ДІЯЛЬНОСТІ БІГУНІВ НА СЕРЕДНІ ДИСТАНЦІЇ
data.journal: Physical culture sports and health of the nation
data.sub_theme: middle-distance running training models
data.summary: Analysis of competitive activity and training approaches in Ukrainian middle-distance runners (800m) reveals that speed abilities, speed endurance, and strength qualities are key success factors, contrasting with traditional Ukrainian emphasis on general endurance.

data.title: Positional and Temporal Intermittency in Football: A Metabolic Model Approach
data.sub_theme: metabolic power, positional intermittency, GPS analysis
data.summary: Analysis of 24 professional football players across 50 matches using GPS technology showed significant positional differences in high and low metabolic load efforts, with the VO2-Pmet method identifying twice longer high metabolic load durations than the fixed Pmet20 threshold.

data.title: Assessment of Cardiorespiratory Fitness In Individuals With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: Systematic Review And Meta-Analysis Protocol (Preprint)
data.sub_theme: cardiorespiratory fitness, type 2 diabetes
data.summary: Systematic review and meta-analysis protocol examining cardiorespiratory fitness assessment in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus, including pulmonary function, exercise capacity, and autonomic dysfunction outcomes.

data.title: Systematic Review of Exercise Interventions in Archery: Injury Management and Performance Outcomes
data.sub_theme: exercise interventions, archery-specific training
data.summary: Systematic review of 15 archery studies found that core stability, Pilates-based balance, and strength training produced moderate-to-large improvements in postural stability, muscle strength, and shooting accuracy, with indirect benefits for injury prevention.

data.title: Musculoskeletal injuries in women aerial acrobatics sports
data.sub_theme: injury incidence, female aerial acrobatics, musculoskeletal injury prevalence
data.summary: A cross-sectional survey of 60 female aerial acrobatics athletes in Saudi Arabia found 20% current injury prevalence with back, knee, and wrist as most common injury sites.

data.title: A novel approach to monitoring selective fatigue in female softball athletes: evaluating load-velocity relationship variables and specific performance metrics
data.sub_theme: fatigue monitoring, load-velocity relationships, softball-specific metrics
data.summary: Load-velocity relationship variables and softball-specific performance metrics (hit/throw distance) showed moderate sensitivity to fatigue in 12 female professional softball players but were less sensitive than blood lactate and RPE.

data.title: The Effect of Educational Intervention on Legal Anti-Doping Knowledge and Doping Tendency in Elite Athletes
data.sub_theme: anti-doping education, doping tendency, legal anti-doping knowledge
data.summary: A structured educational intervention significantly improved legal anti-doping knowledge in 140 elite athletes (50% female) across individual and team sports, but logistic regression found no significant correlation between knowledge gains and reduced doping tendency.

data.title: The nutritional environment and food access of female athletes at HBCUs: a qualitative analysis
data.sub_theme: food security, female student-athletes, HBCUs, nutritional access
data.summary: Qualitative interviews with 10 HBCU female student-athletes revealed evenly split food security status and identified barriers to adequate nutrition including limited cooking resources, inconsistent cafeteria offerings, and time constraints.

data.title: Multi-factorial profiling of athletes integrating personality, psychological skills, and Psychophysiological performance indicators
data.sub_theme: multi-factorial athlete profiling, personality, psychological skills, psychophysiological performance
data.summary: Multivariate and cluster analysis of 304 athletes identified four distinct multi-factorial profiles combining personality traits, psychological skills, and psychophysiological performance indicators (reaction time, stress tolerance, impulsivity) that differed by sport type and competitive level.

data.title: Footwear-Induced Differences in Biomechanics and Perceived Comfort During Unanticipated Side-Step Cutting: An Exploratory Study in Female Football Players
data.sub_theme: footwear design, female football, lower-extremity biomechanics, cutting
data.summary: A pilot study of 20 female football players found that female-specific prototype cleats reduced ankle inversion angles and moments during side-step cutting compared to standard cleats, but participants rated standard cleats as more comfortable.

data.title: A CNN–LSTM–SVM Framework for Mapping Driving Styles to Adaptive Suspension Modes
data.journal: SAE International journal of vehicle dynamics, stability, and NVH
data.sub_theme: vehicle suspension control, CNN-LSTM-SVM, driving styles
data.summary: A machine learning study using CNN-LSTM-SVM architecture for adaptive vehicle suspension control based on driving styles; not relevant to sports.

data.title: The signature of major mergers on the hydrostatic mass bias of galaxy clusters
data.summary: Astrophysics study of hydrostatic mass bias in galaxy clusters during mergers using cosmological simulation; not sports-related.

data.title: Pseudomonas virulence factor SaxA detoxifies plant glucosinolate hydrolysis products, rescuing a commensal that suppresses virulence gene expression
data.summary: Microbiology study of Pseudomonas virulence factors and plant-microbe interactions; not sports-related.

data.title: Perioperative nursing care for a parturient with hypertriglyceridemic acute pancreatitis undergoing cesarean section: A case report
data.summary: Clinical case report on perioperative nursing care for pregnant patient with hypertriglyceridemic acute pancreatitis; not sports-related.

data.title: Assessment of Pain and Dependency Levels in Patient with Paralytic Ileus Associated with Prolonged Antacid Use: Case Report
data.journal: Majalah Keperawatan Unpad/Journal of Nursing Care
data.summary: Clinical case report on pain and dependency assessment in elderly patient with paralytic ileus; not sports-related.

data.title: OPUS Deliverable 5.3 - Open Science Career Assessment Matrix (OSCAM2)
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: Open Science career assessment framework
data.summary: Deliverable report presenting OSCAM2, a framework for assessing Open Science activities of researchers in job applications and career progression at research-performing and research-funding organizations.

data.title: The Impact of Nutritional Status on Survival and Development of Sarcoidosis: A Scoping Review of Current Evidence and Research Gaps
data.sub_theme: nutritional status and sarcoidosis
data.summary: Scoping review examining the relationship between nutritional status (obesity, body composition, calcium–vitamin D metabolism) and sarcoidosis development, clinical course, and prognosis across 18 observational studies.

data.title: Physical activity preferences across demographic groups: a systematic review of population-based evidence and implications for public health and intervention design
data.sub_theme: physical activity preferences across demographic groups
data.summary: Systematic review of 22 population-based studies showing younger individuals prefer high-intensity competitive activities while older adults favor low-impact exercise; gender and socioeconomic factors also influence activity preferences.

data.title: The Multifaceted Role of Irisin in Neurological Disorders: A Systematic Review Integrating Preclinical Evidence with Clinical Observations
data.sub_theme: irisin in neurological disorders
data.summary: Systematic review of 21 clinical and preclinical studies showing irisin, an exercise-induced myokine, has neuroprotective effects in stroke, Parkinson's disease, and Alzheimer's disease with reduced levels predicting poorer outcomes.

data.title: Effects of aerobic exercise on cognitive function in older adults with mild cognitive impairment: a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: aerobic exercise and cognition in mild cognitive impairment
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 33 RCTs (n=1,996) shows aerobic exercise significantly improves global cognition (SMD=0.81) and memory (SMD=0.34) in older adults with mild cognitive impairment, with optimal frequency 3–5 sessions weekly.

data.title: The effect of high-intensity interval training and moderate-intensity continuous training on cardiorespiratory function in healthy elderly individuals: Systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: HIIT vs MICT on cardiorespiratory function in elderly
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 16 RCTs (n=1,434) comparing high-intensity interval training and moderate-intensity continuous training in elderly individuals shows HIIT produces superior improvements in maximal oxygen uptake (MD=1.62 vs 1.22).

data.title: OPUS Deliverable 3.5 OPUS Researcher Assessment Framework (RAF)
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: researcher assessment framework
data.summary: Deliverable report presenting the OPUS Researcher Assessment Framework (RAF), a framework for assessing early-career and senior researchers in job applications and career progression at research organizations.

data.title: OPUS Deliverable 3.5 OPUS Researcher Assessment Framework (RAF)
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: researcher assessment framework
data.summary: Deliverable report presenting the OPUS Researcher Assessment Framework (RAF), a framework for assessing early-career and senior researchers in job applications and career progression at research organizations.

data.title: The Role of Astaxanthin as an Antioxidant and Anti-Inflammatory Agent in Human Health: A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: antioxidant supplementation, astaxanthin
data.summary: Systematic review of astaxanthin supplementation shows consistent reductions in pro-inflammatory cytokines and oxidative stress markers, with combined exercise interventions improving body composition and immune recovery across metabolic and cardiovascular health outcomes.

data.title: Influence of Bilateral Upper Limb Morphological Asymmetry on Grip Strength Related to Gender in Non-Athlete University Students
data.sub_theme: grip strength, upper limb anthropometry, morphological asymmetry
data.summary: A study of 192 non-athlete university students found that bilateral morphological asymmetry influenced grip strength, with males showing higher absolute values but females demonstrating stronger correlations between distal upper-limb morphology and grip strength.

data.title: A periodized winter training block enhances anaerobic capacity in elite female rowers during 30-second maximal rowing
data.sub_theme: anaerobic capacity, periodized training, winter training block
data.summary: A 16-week periodized winter training block in 5 elite female rowers significantly improved anaerobic capacity during a 30-second rowing test, increasing mean power output by 14.1% and anaerobic energy contribution by 22.0% while maintaining VO2max.

data.title: Anorexic Readiness Syndrome in Women Engaging in Body-Shaping Exercise
data.sub_theme: eating disorders, anorexic readiness syndrome, body-shaping exercise
data.summary: A survey of 659 women engaging in body-shaping physical activity found that over 96% showed medium or high levels of Anorexic Readiness Syndrome, with significant correlations between ARS frequency, exercise intensity, and menstrual irregularities.

data.title: Integrated Training Program for Rugby Sevens: A Multivariate Approach of Motor, Functional, and Metabolic Components
data.sub_theme: integrated training, sex-specific adaptations, motor and metabolic components
data.summary: A 12-week integrated training program in 24 elite rugby sevens athletes (12 female, 12 male) showed significant improvements across sprint, jump, aerobic capacity, and metabolic measures, with sex-specific differences where females improved more in aerobic capacity and males in explosive power.

data.title: Integrated Mechanical and Cardiopulmonary Adaptations During Repeated Jumps in Volleyball Players: Insights from CPET Analysis
data.sub_theme: mechanical-metabolic interactions, cardiopulmonary responses, repeated jumping
data.summary: Analysis of 18 female volleyball players performing three consecutive 15-second jump bouts revealed progressive mechanical decline (jump height: 20.59 to 19.30 cm) and increasing oxygen uptake (16.40 to 20.87 mL/min/kg), indicating incomplete recovery under short rest conditions and limited oxidative efficiency.

data.title: Maximal eccentric–concentric strength determines stretch-shortening cycle leg power across biological sexes
data.sub_theme: eccentric-concentric strength, stretch-shortening cycle, sex differences
data.summary: Eccentric-to-concentric force ratio was 7% higher in female competitive athletes but leg extensor concentric strength, not sex, was the primary determinant of countermovement jump power across sexes.

data.title: Characterizing Nanostructured Films Using Phase Sensitive Vibrational Sum Frequency Spectroscopy
data.summary: Materials science study on phase-resolved vibrational sum-frequency spectroscopy for characterization of nanostructured films, not related to sports.

data.title: Enhanced Creatinine Adsorption Kinetics on Defective Polyhedral Morphology of Cu 2 O‐CuO@Pt ( 3d‐2p‐5d ) Nanohybrids for Electrochemical Sensing Application and DFT Investigation
data.summary: This paper on electrochemical creatinine sensing using Cu2O-CuO@Pt nanohybrids has no relevance to sports.

data.title: Mapping expatriate resource gains: the impact of company policy design
data.journal: Journal of Global Mobility The Home of Expatriate Management Research
data.sub_theme: expatriate motivation and company policy design
data.summary: Qualitative study of 37 interviews across five Portuguese multinational firms identifying three expatriate motivational profiles shaped by company policy design and resource dynamics.

data.title: Green New Deal Policy Instruments: Industrial Subsidies, Carbon Pricing, and Innovation Support
data.journal: Scientific journal of economics and management research.
data.sub_theme: climate policy instruments, Green New Deal strategy
data.summary: A policy analysis examines three Green New Deal instruments—carbon pricing, subsidies, and innovation support—concluding that phased combination use is more effective than single tools for deep decarbonization.

data.title: Designing effective financial pathways for ocean economy: a tripartite evolutionary game perspective
data.sub_theme: marine finance, evolutionary game theory
data.summary: A tripartite evolutionary game model of government, banks, and marine enterprises identifies optimal financial support strategies for ocean economy development, with sector-specific recommendations for shipping, desalination, and equipment.

data.title: Redox‐Regulated Phase Switchable Peptide Droplets with Degradation Resistance for Intravenous Delivery of Biopharmaceuticals
data.summary: Study of redox-regulated peptide coacervates for drug delivery to tumors; not sports-related.

data.title: Knowledge and Attitudes of Youth Ice Hockey Players and Their Parents Toward Concussion in the United Kingdom
data.sub_theme: concussion knowledge and attitudes
data.summary: UK youth ice hockey players and parents showed moderate concussion knowledge with parents scoring significantly higher, and a positive correlation between knowledge and safer attitudes toward concussion management in players but not parents.

data.title: The Impact of Banning Female Education on Household Income in Afghanistan
data.journal: International Journal Administration Business and Organization
data.summary: Study of the impact of Afghanistan's ban on girls' education on household income using SEM; not sports-related despite focus on female education.

data.title: SKATER: Synthesized Kinematics for Advanced Traversing Efficiency on a Humanoid Robot via Roller Skate Swizzles
data.sub_theme: roller skating gait optimization in humanoid robots
data.summary: Deep reinforcement learning was applied to optimize swizzle gait mechanics in wheeled humanoid robots, demonstrating 75.86% reduction in impact intensity and 63.34% reduction in cost of transport compared to bipedal walking.

data.title: A Fusion Algorithm for Pedestrian Anomaly Detection and Tracking on Urban Roads Based on Multi-Module Collaboration and Cross-Frame Matching Optimization
data.sub_theme: object detection, anomaly detection in urban environments
data.summary: A deep learning fusion algorithm combining YOLOv8 and BoT-SORT improved detection of anomalous pedestrian behaviors in complex urban traffic environments, achieving 92.2% mAP, but has no sports application.

data.title: The Effect of Physical Activity on Oxidative Stress in Inhibiting Systemic Aging
data.sub_theme: oxidative stress, aging, antioxidant enzymes
data.summary: Literature review found physical exercise increases endogenous antioxidant enzymes and reduces oxidative stress biomarkers, with optimal results at 70-85% VO2max for 8-12 weeks.

data.title: A Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Trial of the ‘Power To Prevent Diabetes Program’ in Bamako, Mali
data.sub_theme: diabetes prevention program, community-based intervention
data.summary: Hybrid effectiveness-implementation trial of adapted Diabetes Prevention Program in Mali showed exercise and dietary interventions reduced HbA1c from 6.5% to 5.4% and increased odds of glucose control by 2.31x.

data.title: Effects of exercise on bone mineral density and bone turnover markers in adults: a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: bone mineral density, bone turnover markers, osteoporosis
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 22 RCTs found exercise significantly increased lumbar spine BMD (SMD = 0.46) and femoral neck BMD (SMD = 0.42) in women under 30 years, with combined exercise most effective.

data.title: A study on the intervention path of rhythmic cheerleading on body image distress and mental health in female cancer patients
data.sub_theme: rhythmic cheerleading, body image, cancer patients
data.summary: Scoping review of 40 articles found rhythmic cheerleading interventions reduce body image distress and improve mental health in female cancer patients through physiological regulation, psychological reconstruction, and social support mechanisms.

data.title: Effects of exercise on anxiety and depression in patients with insomnia: a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: anxiety, depression, insomnia, exercise
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 7 RCTs (336 participants) found exercise significantly improved anxiety (SMD = -0.44), depressed mood (SMD = -0.53), and insomnia severity in patients with chronic insomnia.

data.title: Impacto del Ejercicio Terapéutico sobre las Disfunciones Sexuales en Mujeres y Hombres. Una revisión sistemática.
data.journal: Revista Andaluza de Medicina del Deporte
data.sub_theme: therapeutic exercise, sexual dysfunction, pelvic floor
data.summary: Systematic review of 7 RCTs found therapeutic exercise effective for reducing pain, urinary incontinence, and improving pelvic floor muscle strength and sexual function in patients with sexual dysfunctions.

data.title: Effect of acute exercise on the dynamics of testosterone levels: a systematic review of randomized controlled trials
data.sub_theme: testosterone response, acute exercise, endocrinology
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 15 RCTs (251 participants) found resistance training produces greater testosterone elevation with delayed recovery compared to aerobic exercise, with males showing more pronounced responses than females.

data.title: Effect of cryotherapy on the concentration of interleukin 6 induced by physical exercise:
data.journal: Revista Andaluza de Medicina del Deporte
data.sub_theme: cryotherapy, interleukin-6, recovery, inflammation
data.summary: Literature review of 2 RCTs found conflicting evidence on cryotherapy efficacy: one study showed cold water immersion reduced IL-6 after intense training, while the other found no significant effect on IL-6 levels.

data.title: Who owns the data? Fisheries science, epistemic power, and Russia–Africa relations
data.sub_theme: epistemic power in fisheries governance
data.summary: Paper examines data ownership and epistemic power in Russia–Africa fisheries science cooperation, framing fisheries data control as a political relationship shaping regulatory authority and marine resource governance.

data.title: Քաղաքացիական մասնակցության մշակույթը որպես ժողովրդավարացման և քաղաքացիական հասարակության ինստիտուցիոնալացման նախապայման Հայաստանի Հանրապետությունում (1991-2019 թթ․)
data.sub_theme: political participation and civil society in Armenia
data.summary: Paper analyzes political participation culture as prerequisite for democratization and civil society institutionalization in Armenia (1991–2019), addressing sociopolitical transformations and institutional development.

data.title: The performance, health and development of youth women's footballers: A systematic scoping review
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: youth women's football performance, health, development
data.summary: Systematic scoping review of 294 studies on youth women's footballers identified physical qualities (40%) and injury (17%) as most-studied topics, with significant research gaps in training load, fatigue, and recovery despite rapid growth in literature since 2020.

data.title: The Effect of Adding Supplemental Abdominal Muscle Strengthening to Improve Expiratory Pulmonary Function: A Pilot Study
data.sub_theme: respiratory muscle training, abdominal core strengthening
data.summary: Supplemental abdominal muscle strengthening (external oblique, internal oblique, transverse abdominis) showed minimal statistical significance but strong effect sizes in expiratory pulmonary function metrics in female middle/long-distance runners.

data.title: Thrown off balance: left-handers are under-represented in elite throwing sports
data.sub_theme: left-handedness prevalence, throwing sports
data.summary: Elite track-and-field throwers (javelin, discus, shot put) show striking under-representation of left-handers (2–5%) compared to 10% population prevalence, suggesting handedness disadvantages in non-antagonistic throwing contexts unlike antagonistic sports.

data.title: Excessive Q-Angle and its association with sports injury risk: A literature review
data.journal: International journal of health & medical sciences
data.sub_theme: Q-angle, patellofemoral pain, knee alignment
data.summary: A narrative literature review found that excessive Q-angle is associated with altered lower extremity alignment and increased risk of patellofemoral pain syndrome, iliotibial band syndrome, and knee ligament injuries, with higher prevalence in female athletes and high-impact sports.

data.title: Perceptual gains, performance pains? Massage gun use during warm-up enhances perceived readiness without performance benefits
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: massage gun, warm-up, performance, perceptual readiness
data.summary: A randomized controlled trial of 59 recreational athletes found that massage gun use during warm-up enhanced perceived readiness to perform but impaired several countermovement jump metrics and showed no benefits for mobility or sprinting.

data.title: An observational study of the reliability and concurrent validity of heart rate variability devices in athletes
data.sub_theme: heart rate variability monitoring, device validation, wearables
data.summary: An observational study of 37 trained athletes validated a smartphone PPG app and Polar chest strap for heart rate variability measurement, finding both devices showed good reliability and validity compared to ECG, with the chest strap superior in precision but the app offering a practical low-cost alternative.

data.title: Biomechanics-based analysis of technical characteristics in skeleton start and specific physical training strategies
data.sub_theme: skeleton start technique, kinematic analysis, force production
data.summary: A kinematic and kinetic analysis of skeleton start mechanics in male and female athletes revealed gender differences in starting speed and acceleration, characterized the sport-specific periodic speed-power movements, and recommended training strategies including sprint, push simulations, and core stability work.

data.title: Peak performance: Participating in intergroup competitions facilitates extraordinary performance
data.journal: International Journal of Sports Science & Coaching
data.sub_theme: peak performance, team vs. individual competition, relay swimming
data.summary: Analysis of 100 fastest swimmers' archival data found that significantly more swimmers achieved their all-time peak performance in relay competitions than individual competitions (68 of 100), even after controlling for relay start benefit, supporting the hypothesis that intergroup competition enhances performance.

data.title: Ultrasensitive Electrochemical Biosensor for DNA Methylation Detection Based on Fe-MOF/PANI and Catalytic Hairpin Assembly Cascade Reaction
data.summary: Electrochemistry study on biosensors using metal-organic frameworks for ultrasensitive DNA methylation detection, not related to sports.

data.title: Single‐Component White Light and X‐ray Sensing: Lead‐Free K/Sb:Cs <sub>2</sub> ScCl <sub>5</sub> ·H <sub>2</sub> O Crystals for Dual‐Functional Optoelectronic Applications
data.summary: Materials science study on lead-free perovskite crystals for white-light emission and X-ray detection, not related to sports.

data.title: Advanced Sales Pitch Analysis and Performance Recommendation System Using AI-Driven Speech and Behavioral Analytics
data.journal: International Journal of Innovative Science and Research Technology (IJISRT)
data.sub_theme: speech and behavioral analytics for sales training
data.summary: AI-driven system using speech-to-text, emotion recognition, and behavioral analysis to automate evaluation of sales pitches and provide personalized performance recommendations.

data.title: Improving Pediatric Concussion Management in the Primary Care Setting
data.sub_theme: pediatric concussion management, return-to-play protocols
data.summary: A quality improvement initiative in primary care increased standardized concussion evaluation from 37% to 85% and reduced disparities in symptom scale use and follow-up care for pediatric patients.

data.title: The Role of AI-Driven Marketing Insights in Enhancing Financial Performance and Competitive Advantage
data.journal: RIGGS Journal of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Business
data.sub_theme: AI-driven marketing analytics, business strategy
data.summary: A qualitative literature review examines how AI-driven marketing insights improve financial performance and competitive advantage by linking marketing activities to measurable business outcomes.

data.title: EFFECTS OF ACCOUNTING EARNINGS AND AGRIBUSINESS EXPANSION ON GROSS DOMESTIC PRODUCT
data.sub_theme: agricultural economics, economic growth modeling
data.summary: Panel data analysis of Indonesian agribusiness firms (2015–2023) reveals that accounting earnings have significant indirect effects on GDP through agricultural gross domestic product as an intervening variable.

data.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Financial Trading: Enhanced by Cluster Embedding and Zero-Shot Prediction
data.sub_theme: reinforcement learning for algorithmic trading
data.summary: A Cluster Embedding-PPO deep reinforcement learning framework for financial trading integrates predicted future OHLCV data with observed data, achieving 137.94% cumulative return on the S&P 500.

data.title: Crypto Fundamental Analysis: Comparison of Cryptos with the Largest Market Capitalizations
data.journal: International Journal of Economics, Commerce, and Management.
data.sub_theme: cryptocurrency volatility and market efficiency
data.summary: Panel regression analysis of five largest cryptocurrencies (2019–2023) shows that trading volume and price increase return volatility while market capitalization stabilizes it, with Binance Coin demonstrating highest market efficiency.

data.title: The Paradoxes of Public Philosophy
data.sub_theme: philosophy of public engagement
data.summary: A philosophical essay argues that public philosophy's contribution is limited to 'discursive hygiene' (argument clarification) rather than substantive normative knowledge, and advocates learning from legal rhetoric.

data.title: МЕТОДИЧНІ ПІДХОДИ ДО РОЗВИТКУ СИЛОВИХ ЗДІБНОСТЕЙ ЗДОБУВАЧІВ ВИЩОЇ ОСВІТИ НА ЗАНЯТТЯХ З ДИСЦИПЛІНИ «ТЕОРІЯ І МЕТОДИКА ВИКЛАДАННЯ АТЛЕТИЗМУ»
data.journal: Physical culture sports and health of the nation
data.sub_theme: strength training development in athletics education
data.summary: Pedagogical experiment with 35 higher education students in Ukraine demonstrates that superset-based strength training program effectively develops maximum strength, explosive power, and strength endurance.

data.title: Assessment of the effectiveness of exercise interventions in the treatment of PTSD: based on a systematic evaluation and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: PTSD treatment, exercise interventions
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 14 RCTs found exercise interventions significantly reduced PTSD symptoms (SMD = -0.35), with yoga and resistance training most effective and female patients deriving greater benefit.

data.title: Prevalence of Reporting Bias in Abstracts of Meniscal Transplant Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses: Increased Association With Study Age: A Systematic Review
data.journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
data.sub_theme: reporting bias in systematic reviews, meniscal transplant
data.summary: Systematic review identified spin (reporting bias) in 46.3% of meniscal transplant abstracts, with selective reporting of efficacy outcomes as the most common bias type.

data.title: Measuring the Impact of Microplastics in the Citarum River on Women's Reproductive Health: A Chronic Exposure Biomarker Study in the Community
data.journal: Knowledge and Environmental Science for Living and Global Health
data.sub_theme: microplastic exposure and reproductive health biomarkers
data.summary: A cross-sectional biomonitoring study found chronic exposure to microplastics in the Citarum River was associated with elevated oxidative stress, inflammatory biomarkers, reduced anti-Müllerian hormone levels, and menstrual cycle disturbances in women of reproductive age.

data.title: Weight Loss Trends in Women’s Wrestling and Potential Implications of Menstrual Cycle: A Narrative Review
data.sub_theme: weight loss, menstrual cycle, female wrestlers
data.summary: Narrative review of weight loss trends in female wrestlers reveals sex-specific menstrual cycle effects on fluid retention and body composition that require tailored weight management strategies for this population.

data.title: Emotional intelligence in shaping junior athletes’ productive coping strategies
data.sub_theme: emotional intelligence, coping strategies, junior athletes
data.summary: Emotional intelligence predicts productive coping strategies (self-control, problem-solving, positive reappraisal) in junior athletes aged 15–19, with managing emotions influencing self-control and self-motivation influencing acceptance of responsibility.

data.title: The Cross-Cultural Adaptation, Validation and Psychometric Properties of the Mental Fatigue Scale in Turkish Athletes
data.sub_theme: Mental Fatigue Scale validation, Turkish athletes
data.summary: Cross-cultural adaptation and validation of the Mental Fatigue Scale in Turkish adolescent and adult athletes demonstrated acceptable factorial validity and reliable measurement of general mental fatigue across age groups.

data.title: Effect of PAPE induced by different squat loads on jump performance in collegiate female basketball players
data.journal: BMC Sports Science Medicine and Rehabilitation
data.sub_theme: PAPE, squat load, jump performance, female athletes
data.summary: In collegiate female basketball players, 80% 1RM back-squat with 8–12-minute recovery optimally enhanced jump performance through earlier gastrocnemius activation and stable neuromuscular output compared to 70% or 90% loads.

data.title: The characteristics of lower extremity muscle activity and static balance of Chinese elite trampoline athletes during net contact phase
data.sub_theme: lower extremity muscle activity, balance, trampoline athletes
