data.summary: Elite Chinese trampoline athletes show significant gender differences in lower limb dynamics during net contact: males exhibit stronger gastrocnemius activity and left-ward center-of-gravity shift; females show superior right-side balance in closed-eye conditions.

data.title: Exploring the Identity Representation and Empowerment of Pakistani Women Athletes: An Ethnographic Study of Pakistan Sports Board (PSB), Islamabad
data.sub_theme: identity representation, empowerment, Pakistani women athletes
data.summary: Ethnographic study of Pakistani women athletes reveals resilience in navigating intersecting barriers (restricted facility access, family pressure, harassment) through subtle resistance and agency negotiation within cultural frameworks, challenging Western-centric empowerment narratives.

data.title: Dieting, disordered eating and perfectionism in weight-classified combat sports: a pilot study
data.sub_theme: rapid weight loss, disordered eating, perfectionism
data.summary: Weight-classified combat sport athletes (kickboxers, BJJ) exhibit low overall disordered eating symptoms (15% above cutoff) despite frequent rapid weight loss practices; both adaptive and maladaptive perfectionism associate with eating disorder symptoms.

data.title: Electrochemical DNA Biosensor Based on Pt <sup>2+</sup> -Doped ZnCo <sub>2</sub> O <sub>4</sub> for Sensitive Detection of the Anti-Cancer Drug Sunitinib
data.summary: Chemistry and electrochemistry study on DNA biosensors for detection of the anti-cancer drug Sunitinib, not related to sports.

data.title: Low-Cost and Efficient Neoliquiritin Monitoring via Sulfur and Phosphorus Co-Doped Graphene Oxide-Based Electrochemical Platform
data.summary: Electrochemistry study on graphene oxide-based sensors for detection of neoliquiritin flavonoid, not related to sports.

data.title: Quantum and thermodynamic evaluation of C24 fullerene-based nanosensors for detection of mydayis in biomedical and drug detection applications
data.summary: Computational chemistry study using DFT and quantum methods to evaluate fullerene-based nanosensors for drug detection, not related to sports.

data.title: Tracing strategic divergence: archetypal and counterfactual analysis of StarCraft II gameplay trajectories
data.sub_theme: StarCraft II strategic analysis and gameplay trajectories
data.summary: TRACE framework using Conditional Recurrent Variational Autoencoder to analyze StarCraft II professional gameplay, identifying strategic deviations in early game (8.4% of match duration) driven by technology timing gaps with 90% similarity improvement in counterfactual alignment.

data.title: PHYSICAL, PHYSIOLOGICAL, AND PSYCHOLOGICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF JUNIOR ROWERS - A SYSTEMATIC REVIEW
data.journal: Facta Universitatis Series Physical Education and Sport
data.sub_theme: junior rowers, talent identification, physical and psychological characteristics, U19 athletes
data.summary: A systematic review of 20 studies on U19 rowers identifies key anthropometric, aerobic, anaerobic, motor, and psychological characteristics associated with 2000m ergometer performance, emphasizing integrated development of aerobic capacity, strength training, and psychological resilience for talent identification.

data.title: Cultural Significance of Gold Across Societies and Its Impact on Investment Decisions
data.journal: International Journal of Advanced Research in Science Communication and Technology
data.summary: A descriptive and analytical study examining the cultural significance of gold in different societies and its impact on investment decision-making using convenience sampling and statistical analysis.

data.title: Sex Differences in Severity and Recovery Following Mild Traumatic Brain Injury: A Systematic Review
data.sub_theme: mild traumatic brain injury, concussion, sex differences
data.summary: A systematic review of 41 studies (15,656 participants) showing females report greater symptom burden, longer recovery times, and more extensive white matter alterations than males following mild traumatic brain injury.

data.title: Pengaruh Struktur Modal dan Perputaran Aset Tetap terhadap Tingkat Pengembalian Aset pada PT Argo Pantes Tbk Periode 2013-2022
data.summary: A quantitative study using multiple linear regression analysis to examine the effect of capital structure and fixed asset turnover on return on assets in PT Argo Pantes Tbk (2013-2022).

data.title: Modeling epidemiological patterns of smallpox in Copenhagen in the 19 th century after the introduction of the vaccine
data.sub_theme: smallpox vaccination dynamics, disease modeling
data.summary: A mechanistic SEIR model of historical smallpox epidemiology in Copenhagen (1824–1875) demonstrates that vaccine waning after ~20 years explains the disease's return and changing age distribution following a mandatory vaccination program.

data.title: Deliberative Democracy or Agonistic Pluralism?
data.sub_theme: democratic theory, political philosophy
data.summary: A philosophical critique of deliberative democracy theory arguing that agonistic pluralism better accounts for the conflictual nature of democratic politics and the role of collective identification.

data.title: Treatment of Second and Third Carpometacarpal Joint Instability in Elite Boxers
data.journal: The Journal of Hand Surgery (Asian-Pacific Volume)
data.sub_theme: carpometacarpal joint instability, hand injuries in boxers, surgical treatment
data.summary: Retrospective case series of 20 elite boxers (19 male, 1 female) with carpometacarpal joint instability treated conservatively (7) or surgically (13); all returned to pre-injury competition level pain-free using IK classification-based strategy with single-screw arthrodesis.

data.title: The application of principal component analysis to distinguish the kinematics parameters of hammer throw technique among athletes of varying levels participating in the European Throwing Cup for the years 2018 and 2022
data.sub_theme: hammer throw kinematics, principal component analysis, technique analysis
data.summary: Principal component analysis of 3D kinematics from 71 hammer throwers (39 male, 32 female) at European Throwing Cup revealed that Turn 4 velocity, amplitude, and timing were critical performance factors, with age/gender-specific technique recommendations.

data.title: Sweat sodium composition and sweat loss estimation through wearable sensors and predictive equations in dry and humid hot conditions
data.sub_theme: sweat sodium, hydration assessment
data.summary: Wearable sweat sensor (S1) provided equivalent sweat sodium measurement to handheld analyzer and accurate whole-body sweat loss estimation during cycling in hot/humid conditions, validating its practical use for individualized hydration strategies.

data.title: Photothermal microtip with “nanotrap” on a fiber-optic end-face grating for specific sensing of inert gas Xe
data.summary: Optics and materials science study on fiber-optic xenon gas sensing using photothermal techniques, not related to sports.

data.title: Nitrogen-Doped Biochar Derived from Starch for Enzyme-Free Colorimetric Detection of Uric Acid in Human Body Fluids
data.summary: Chemistry study on nitrogen-doped biochar for colorimetric detection of uric acid in biological fluids, not related to sports.

data.title: Impact of Proximal Conjoint Tendon Injury on Return to Play in the BF–ST Complex: A Prospective MRI-Based Study
data.sub_theme: hamstring conjoint tendon injury; return-to-play prognosis
data.summary: A prospective MRI-based study of 41 university rugby players found that full-layer biceps femoris–semitendinosus conjoint tendon injuries, particularly with bilateral involvement, required approximately twice as long return-to-play (11.4 weeks) compared to isolated injuries (4–5 weeks).

data.title: Pengaruh Pengelolaan Modal Kerja dan Struktur Modal terhadap Profitabilitas pada Perusahaan Kosmetik dan Perawatan Tubuh yang Terdaftar di BEI Tahun 2020-2024
data.sub_theme: working capital and capital structure effects on profitability
data.summary: A panel regression analysis of six cosmetic and personal care companies (2020–2024) found that capital structure had a positive and significant effect on profitability, while working capital management had no significant effect.

data.title: Impact of Injury on Anxiety, Depression, and Quality of Life in Youth Soccer Players
data.sub_theme: mental health and quality of life outcomes post-injury in youth soccer
data.summary: A cross-sectional study of 668 elite youth soccer athletes (ECNL) found that currently injured players reported significantly higher anxiety and depression and lower quality of life than uninjured players, with negative psychosocial impacts persisting even after return to play.

data.title: The role of the efforts of the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq in supporting efforts to restore stability.
data.sub_theme: United Nations role in Iraqi stability
data.summary: A descriptive and analytical study examining the UN Assistance Mission for Iraq's role in restoring stability through human rights monitoring, institutional capacity-building, and support for internally displaced persons.

data.title: SETI in the Real World: Post-Detection and More
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: SETI post-detection protocols and science communication
data.summary: A position paper describing recent developments in the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI) post-detection landscape, including revised protocols, international workshops, and challenges in communicating potential discoveries of extraterrestrial life.

data.title: SETI in the Real World: Post-Detection and More
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: SETI post-detection protocols and science communication
data.summary: A position paper describing recent developments in the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI) post-detection landscape, including revised protocols, international workshops, and challenges in communicating potential discoveries of extraterrestrial life.

data.title: Adoption of returnable packaging depends on price, deposit, and material, with spillovers from recycling and reuse
data.sub_theme: consumer preferences for returnable packaging
data.summary: A discrete choice experiment with UK consumers (n=nationally representative) found that higher prices and deposits reduced returnable packaging adoption, glass was preferred to plastic, and prior engagement in recycling/reuse behaviors predicted greater adoption of returnable formats.

data.title: An Unusual Cause of Buttock Pain in a Collegiate Football Player: A Septic Sacroiliac Joint
data.sub_theme: septic sacroiliac joint infection; return-to-play case
data.summary: A case report of a 21-year-old collegiate football player with septic sacroiliitis caused by methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus, highlighting diagnostic challenges of joint infection in young athletes and demonstrating full recovery with prompt antibiotic therapy and return to play after three months.

data.title: Thimerosal, an organic mercury compound used as a vaccine preservative: A real necessity or regulatory inertia? Contributions from analytical chemistry
data.summary: A review of thimerosal use as a vaccine preservative, examining its antimicrobial properties, mercury content, toxicology, and regulatory status across different countries.

data.title: Distinct mechanisms drive post-antibiotic Tuberculosis relapse post-cure versus post-treatment-failure
data.summary: A computational modeling study examining mechanisms of tuberculosis relapse post-treatment, comparing persistence-driven versus threshold-driven relapse in diagnostic and clinical contexts.

data.title: Strategi Bertahan Usaha Mikro Kecil Menengah (UMKM) dalam Menghadapi Krisis Ekonomi Global
data.journal: Journal of Economic and Business Advancement
data.summary: A descriptive qualitative case study of MSME survival strategies during economic crises, examining product innovation, cost control, and competitive positioning in a microenterprise.

data.title: From Virtual Trials to Real Sustainability: Augmented Reality as a Catalyst for Circular Consumption in Retail
data.journal: International Scientific Journal of Engineering and Management
data.summary: A structural equation modeling study examining how augmented reality virtual trials influence sustainable consumption behaviors and return rates in retail environments.

data.title: Trajectories of changes in oxytocin and vasopressin before, during, and after mother-infant interaction: a descriptive study of mothers and infants affected by postpartum depression
data.summary: A descriptive study of oxytocin and vasopressin trajectories in mothers and infants before, during, and after interaction, comparing postpartum depression and non-PPD groups.

data.title: Evaluation of Promising Cultivars in Major Chickpea Cultivating Districts of Haryana State
data.summary: An economic evaluation of promising chickpea cultivars in Haryana, India, examining yield, benefit-cost ratios, and returns to farmers using purposive multistage sampling.

data.title: Case Study: Prevalence of Hip Pain and Femoroacetabular Impingement in Professional Table Tennis Players
data.sub_theme: femoroacetabular impingement, hip pathology
data.summary: A case series documenting 58% prevalence of hip pain and 42% prevalence of femoroacetabular impingement in 19 professional table tennis players, with 26% requiring surgical intervention.

data.title: BD Sports-10: A comprehensive video dataset for Bangladeshi sports classification and analysis
data.sub_theme: Bangladeshi traditional sports video dataset for classification and analysis
data.summary: BD Sports-10 dataset comprises 3,000 videos of ten Bangladeshi traditional sports with standardized resolution and frame rates, enabling deep learning and computer vision research for sport classification, object detection, and player tracking.

data.title: Nutritional Compositions of Field Crickets (Gryllinae) Obtained in Sokoto State, Nigeria
data.journal: Scholars Journal of Engineering and Technology
data.summary: Nutritional composition analysis of field crickets (insects) as food; not related to sport.

data.title: Sentiment Analysis of X Users Regarding Bandung Regency Using Support Vector Machine
data.sub_theme: sentiment analysis, local governance
data.summary: A Support Vector Machine sentiment analysis of social media posts regarding Bandung Regency achieved 83% negative recall, with football mentioned only incidentally in word frequency analysis rather than as the primary subject of study.

data.title: Aktualisasi Ketubuhan Perempuan dan Representasi Estetika Hindu Dalam Tari Rejang Pedawa
data.sub_theme: female body actualization in Hindu ritual dance
data.summary: Philosophical and esthetic analysis of Rejang Pedawa dance performed by adolescent Hindu women demonstrates how female body movements serve as medium for worship, cosmic energy channeling, and bridge between human and divine realms within Balinese village spirituality.

data.title: Assessment of Temporomandibular Disorders, Oral Health Status, Knowledge and Hygiene Behaviours Among Athletes in Croatia: A Cross-Sectional Study
data.sub_theme: oral health, temporomandibular disorders, dental trauma in athletes
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 1,007 Croatian athletes found moderate oral health knowledge (11.3/18), good brushing habits (86.9%), but low flossing compliance (25.4%), with no significant differences between contact and non-contact sports.

data.title: Optimising Recovery Intervals for Post-Activation Performance Enhancement: A Systematic Review of Vertical Jump Outcomes
data.sub_theme: post-activation performance enhancement, vertical jump, recovery intervals
data.summary: Systematic review of 31 studies (2015-2025) showed PAPE protocols improved countermovement jump by 1.5-12% (median +6%), with moderate recovery intervals (3-7 min) most reliable; heavy-load squats and variable resistance yielded largest gains.

data.title: Prevalence of Musculoskeletal Injuries in Volleyball Players with a Focus on Lower Limbs and the Predictive Value of the Tuck Jump Assessment: A Cross-sectional Study
data.journal: Journal of Clinical Research in Paramedical Sciences
data.sub_theme: lower limb injury prevalence, Tuck Jump Assessment, screening
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 139 youth volleyball players found 27% injury prevalence with knee (31%), ankle (24%), and shoulder (15%) most affected; age, height, weight, and training experience predicted injury risk, but Tuck Jump Assessment did not (P=0.12).

data.title: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis of Anterior Cruciate Ligament Injury Prevention Programs: Training to Stay in the Game
data.journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
data.sub_theme: ACL injury prevention programs, neuromuscular training
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 18 studies (25,166 athletes, >85% female) showed ACL prevention programs reduced ACL rupture risk by 54% (RR 0.46, 95% CI 0.36-0.57), with greater efficacy in females (RR 0.57) and soccer/handball players (RR 0.30-0.66).

data.title: Amino‐functionalized lanthanide metal‐organic frameworks encapsulating boron‐doped graphene quantum dots: A paper based fluorescent sensor to visual detection of salicylic acid
data.summary: This is a materials science paper on a fluorescent sensor using lanthanide metal-organic frameworks and graphene quantum dots for environmental salicylic acid detection; not related to sport.

data.title: Bimodal Mechanoluminescence Enables Multicolor Luminescent Tailing for Ultra‐Accurate Loading Speed Visualization and Detection
data.summary: Materials science study on mechanoluminescent phosphors for mechanical sensing applications, not related to sports.

data.title: Research on Neutron Irradiation Performance of Novel Boron-Containing Composite Glass Scintillators
data.summary: Materials science and physics study on boron-containing scintillators for neutron detection, not related to sports.

data.title: External Load in High-Level Tennis Training: Influence of Game-Specific Drills in Junior and Professional Players Across Playing Situations
data.sub_theme: external load, game-specific drills, training demands
data.summary: Analysis of 345 on-court tennis drills using wearable inertial technology found that baseline and all-court drills produced highest external load demands, with juniors covering more distance than professionals but professionals showing greater acceleration/deceleration values.

data.title: Rekonversi Umat Kristen ke Agama Hindu Kaharingan di Kabupaten Pulang Pisau, Kalimantan Tengah
data.sub_theme: religious reconversion
data.summary: A qualitative case study examining religious reconversion from Christianity to Hindu Kaharingan in Indonesia, identifying three primary factors: personal will, mixed marriages, and religious legitimacy ceremonies.

data.title: Trends in Intake, Length of Stay and Outcome Data in a Portuguese Animal Shelter Between 2018 and 2024
data.sub_theme: animal shelter outcomes
data.summary: A retrospective regression analysis of 2,291 animals in a Portuguese shelter (2018-2024) found that length of stay was the strongest predictor of adoption outcomes, with microchipped animals 71 times more likely to be returned to owners.

data.title: Effects of high-intensity interval training on aerobic capacity and muscle adaptation: a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: high-intensity interval training effects on aerobic capacity and muscle adaptation
data.summary: Systematic review and meta-analysis of 24 controlled trials shows high-intensity interval training produces moderate improvements in aerobic capacity comparable to or greater than moderate-intensity continuous training, with heterogeneous but generally beneficial effects on muscular oxidative capacity.

data.title: Time pressure and player disadvantage: Effects on jump performance in simulated matches of well-trained amateur handball players
data.journal: Journal of Coaching and Sports Science
data.sub_theme: time pressure, fatigue, jumping performance
data.summary: Jumping performance (countermovement jump height, rate of force development, power) increased significantly after simulated handball matches regardless of player disadvantage, showing no consistent fatigue-induced decline under time pressure.

data.title: Sex differences in electrocardiograms of trained athletes: a systematic review and meta-analysis
data.sub_theme: sex differences in athlete electrocardiograms, sudden cardiac death screening
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 85 studies (19,069 female and 57,745 male athletes) found female athletes twice as likely to have abnormal T-wave inversion and six times more likely to have isolated TWI in V1-V3, with no associated cardiac pathology diagnoses.

data.title: Career coaching and the making of the neoliberal subject in Türkiye: Bringing docility back in
data.sub_theme: career coaching and neoliberal subjectivity
data.summary: Critical discourse analysis of career coaching in Turkey examining neoliberal subjectivity and docility through interviews and online content analysis, not related to sports.

data.title: Biomechanical analysis of the push-up exercise in university male student-athletes from different specializations: a sport-based comparative study
data.sub_theme: push-up kinematics, sport-specific motor control
data.summary: Comparative biomechanical analysis of push-ups in 80 male athletes from gymnastics, swimming, track, and basketball revealed sport-specific neuromuscular signatures: gymnasts showed superior trunk stability, swimmers greater shoulder mobility, and sprinters/basketball players higher force development.

data.title: Identification of health educational needs of women in a vulnerable region
data.sub_theme: women's health education needs in vulnerable populations
data.summary: Cross-sectional survey of 1,478 Colombian women (18–44 years) attending primary care identifies differential health education needs by life-cycle stage (contraception, vaccination, mental health, postpartum care), with education and municipality as main determinants of knowledge performance.

data.title: Quantifying perceived stress and burnout of NCAA division I athletic department support staff members
data.sub_theme: burnout, perceived stress, athletic department support staff
data.summary: NCAA Division I athletic department support staff (n=314) reported moderate perceived stress and personal/work-related burnout with positive correlations between stress and all burnout dimensions; staff with regular student-athlete interaction reported higher personal burnout.

data.title: Decreased Hip Strength Leads to Altered Dynamic Motion Biomechanics in Healthy Female Athletes
data.journal: The Journal of Strength and Conditioning Research
data.sub_theme: hip strength, landing mechanics, injury prevention, female athletes
data.summary: Forty-six female athletes with decreased hip strength showed significantly altered drop vertical jump landing biomechanics (13° less hip flexion, 9.7° less knee flexion, 7.6° less anterior pelvic tilt) but no differences in side-cutting, suggesting hip strength assessment may improve injury prevention screening.

data.title: Sex-Based Performance Differences in Shot Put, Javelin, and Long Jump Among U.S. Youth Athletes Aged 10 Years and Under
data.journal: The Journal of Strength and Conditioning Research
data.sub_theme: sex-based performance differences, youth athletes, throwing and jumping events
data.summary: Analysis of USA Track & Field Regional Junior Olympic Championships data (2022-2024) revealed significant sex-based performance differences in prepubertal athletes (8-10 years) across javelin (Hedges' g=1.1-1.14), shot put (g=0.73-0.74), and long jump (g=0.43-0.47), with males outperforming females by 8-55% depending on event.

data.title: The Effect of Plyometric Training on Ability Javelin Throw by Pasi Sleman Athletes
data.journal: International Journal of Innovative Science and Research Technology (IJISRT)
data.sub_theme: plyometric training, javelin throw, training effects
data.summary: Plyometric training over 16 sessions improved javelin throwing ability in 10 PASI Sleman athletes (ages 14-20): overall increase of 4.116 meters (14.99%), with female athletes improving 9.41% and male athletes 10.19%.

data.title: The impact of sport engagement on life satisfaction, mental and psychological well-being among athletes
data.sub_theme: sport engagement, life satisfaction, mental well-being
data.summary: Sport engagement significantly predicted sportive life satisfaction, mental well-being, and psychological well-being among 473 Turkish athletes across multiple disciplines using correlation and regression analysis.

data.title: Analysis of the Dominant Physical Capacity Components of Volleyball Players in the Train to Train Phase
data.sub_theme: physical capacity assessment, youth volleyball
data.summary: Descriptive analysis of 54 youth volleyball players (ages 12-16) showed good physical condition profiles across most biomotor components, with leg power and strength dominating at 68-77% in the good category.

data.title: Addressing Gender Inequity in Australian Sports Leadership: A Postfeminist Policy Paradox
data.journal: Journal of Sport and Social Issues
data.sub_theme: gender balance in sports leadership and coaching
data.summary: Case study analysis of two Australian sports governing bodies shows gender equity initiatives focus on individual skill development rather than institutional structural change, perpetuating leadership disparities.

data.title: Nonlinear optical properties investigation of 2D PbI2 material and its application in Yb-doped mode-locking fiber laser
data.summary: This is a materials science paper on nonlinear optical properties of 2D lead iodide for mode-locking fiber laser applications; not related to sport.

data.title: Revolutionizing Athlete Management in the Indian Sporting Industry
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: athlete management system design
data.summary: Design and implementation of a role-based Athlete Management System for Indian sports with modules for performance tracking, training schedules, nutrition management, and communication.

data.title: Revolutionizing Athlete Management in the Indian Sporting Industry
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)
data.sub_theme: athlete management system design
data.summary: Design and implementation of a role-based Athlete Management System for Indian sports with modules for performance tracking, training schedules, nutrition management, and communication.

data.title: Semantic Event Graphs for Long-Form Video Question Answering
data.sub_theme: video question answering, semantic event graphs, vision-language models
data.summary: Computer vision paper proposes Semantic Event Graphs for long-form video question answering, achieving 65% accuracy with 91.4% token reduction on YouTube videos through temporal interaction logs and symbolic reasoning.

data.title: Refugee Gastronomy and Sustainable Development: The Case of Gaziantep
data.journal: Toros University Journal of Food Nutrition and Gastronomy
data.sub_theme: refugee integration, gastronomy, sustainable development
data.summary: Qualitative study on refugee gastronomy and cultural integration in Gaziantep, examining food as a tool for sustainable development and social cohesion.

data.title: Testing Market Efficiency in The Main Metal Industry Sector
data.sub_theme: market efficiency, efficient markets hypothesis, metal industry index
data.summary: Econometric analysis of Borsa Istanbul metal industry index (2015-2025) tests market efficiency using unit root, variance ratio, and BDS tests, confirming random walk hypothesis and validity of both EMH and AMH.

data.title: A Machine Learning Framework for Off Ball Defensive Role and Performance Evaluation in Football
data.sub_theme: off-ball defense, hidden markov models, corner kicks
data.summary: Covariate-dependent Hidden Markov Model applied to tracking data inferred man-marking and zonal defensive assignments from corner kicks, enabling context-aware credit attribution and counterfactual evaluation of off-ball defensive performance.

data.title: Functional Asymmetries in Youth Soccer Players: A Systematic Review of Assessment Technologies and Artificial Intelligence Applications
data.sub_theme: functional asymmetries, AI-based assessment, wearable technology
data.summary: A systematic review of 28 studies found that AI-based models and wearable technologies can assess functional asymmetries in youth soccer players, with strength asymmetries exceeding 15% significantly associated with increased injury risk.

data.title: Gender, authority and the role of the referee in sportjournalism
data.journal: KTH Publication Database DiVA (KTH Royal Institute of Technology)
data.sub_theme: media representation of female referees
data.summary: Swedish sports journalism systematically frames female football referees as pioneers or emotionally exposed actors while depicting male referees as neutral technical experts, reproducing gendered norms that constrain women's legitimacy in authoritative roles.

data.title: Perfiles de cargo y equidad de género en las organizaciones deportivas de orden departamental
data.sub_theme: gender equity in regional sports organizations
data.summary: Study of three Colombian regional sports organizations shows structured job profiles exist but men occupy 80% of decision-making positions; significant progress in formal hiring equality driven by quota law, though cultural stereotypes and gender violence response capacity remain major challenges.

data.title: Anything but Endo: Diagnostic Buck‐Passing in Endometriosis Diagnosis
data.sub_theme: diagnostic journeys in endometriosis
data.summary: Medical sociology study analyzing diagnostic buck-passing in endometriosis care through interviews with 52 US patients identifies epistemic injustice and wilful ignorance as barriers to timely diagnosis due to underinvestment in women's health research.

data.title: Age, Workload, and Usage Rate: Risk Factors Associated With Knee Injuries in Women’s National Basketball Association Athletes
data.sub_theme: knee injury epidemiology
data.summary: Epidemiological analysis of WNBA players (2017–2022) found knee injury incidence of 6.03 per 1000 minutes-exposures, with older age and higher usage rate as significant risk factors.

data.title: Exploring the impact of gender and athletic involvement on career adaptability in Physical Education students
data.sub_theme: career adaptability in physical education students
data.summary: A study of 687 Physical Education students found no significant differences in career adaptability based on gender or athletic status, suggesting career readiness is driven by individual traits rather than sports involvement.

data.title: Voices of Change: A Qualitative Analysis of the Motivations Behind Female Athlete Activism at Tokyo 2020
data.sub_theme: motivations for athlete activism and marginalized identities
data.summary: Qualitative analysis of intersectionally marginalized female U.S. Olympians at Tokyo 2020 identified that psychological needs for autonomy, competence, and belonging, combined with socialization, drive athlete activism behaviors.

data.title: Analysis of technical performance of pencak silat athletes in the sparring category of men's class c, men's class e and women's class b at malang state university
data.sub_theme: technical performance in pencak silat sparring
data.summary: Video analysis of pencak silat athletes across three weight classes revealed that the sickle kick was the dominant technique (33-39% of actions) with 70-85% success rates, with left-sided execution showing higher effectiveness.

data.title: Acute effects of dietary whey protein supplementation after endurance exercise on serum osteokine and inflammatory cytokine concentrations in endurance runners
data.sub_theme: whey protein supplementation and bone resorption in endurance runners
data.summary: A randomized controlled trial in young endurance runners found that acute post-exercise whey protein supplementation did not significantly attenuate bone resorption or inflammatory cytokine responses compared to control after exhaustive running.

data.title: A246: Epidemiological Characteristics of Injury Among Chinese Rowing Athletes
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: injury incidence and patterns in Chinese rowing athletes
data.summary: A cross-sectional study of 207 Chinese rowing athletes found an overall injury rate of 38.2% with lower back injuries most common (39.7%), and female athletes over 18 years experiencing significantly higher injury rates per training session (7.85/1000) compared to younger males.

data.title: Leveraging the Enhanced Sports as a Laboratory Assessment Model to Cross-Validate a Formula Used to Predict Clinical Recovery From Concussion in Collegiate Athletes
data.sub_theme: concussion recovery prediction in collegiate athletes
data.summary: Cross-validation of a prognostic formula for concussion recovery in 133 collegiate athletes found weak predictive accuracy, with only 30.4% correctly classified for 14-day recovery but 80.6% correctly identified for prolonged recovery (≥15 days).

data.title: A207: AI Era and Sports Equity
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: AI's impact on sports equity, inclusion, and gender representation
data.summary: Qualitative analysis of AI use in university sports found that while AI-driven training tools improved accessibility, AI in officiating and talent selection reinforced inequalities, with AI metrics favoring male performance over female athletes and well-funded programs.

data.title: Discoprins & Powerbrud : A critical discourse analysis of how gender is portrayed in Swedish digital news media during the 2025 World Athletics Championships
data.sub_theme: gender representation in sports journalism coverage
data.summary: Critical discourse analysis of 160 Swedish news articles about World Athletics Championships 2025 revealed systematic gender differences in coverage, with female athletes receiving more focus on emotions and private life versus male athletes' technical performance.

data.title: A231: Effects of a Six-Week Pre-Competition Program on Blood Biomarkers in Female Adolescent Rowers
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: blood biomarkers, hematological adaptation, endocrine response
data.summary: Six-week pre-competition training in adolescent female rowers produced significant increases in RBC, MCV, testosterone, and T/C ratio while maintaining all markers within clinical norms, indicating beneficial physiological adaptation.

data.title: “Each Athlete Is Very Different, and This Is Why I’m Still Learning Every Day”: Experiences of Coaching Elite Athletes With Intellectual Disability and/or Autism
data.sub_theme: elite coaches, intellectual disability, autism, specialized coaching
data.summary: Qualitative analysis of 24 elite coaches revealed significant interpersonal, environmental, and sport-specific challenges when coaching athletes with intellectual disabilities and/or autism, highlighting the need for specialized coach education.

data.title: Motor competence explains the variance in biomechanical variables related to anterior cruciate ligament injury risk, with distinct predictors for male and female athletes
data.sub_theme: ACL injury risk, biomechanics, motor competence, landing mechanics
data.summary: Motor competence explained 69.6% of variance in kinetic and kinematic variables associated with ACL injury risk (knee flexion angle, knee abduction angle) in elite basketball, volleyball, and handball athletes, with distinct gender-specific predictors.

data.title: A087: Assessment of Table Tennis Stroke Effectiveness Using the Artificial Intelligence Technology-Based Algorithm
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: table tennis, stroke effectiveness, skill assessment
data.summary: Dynamic time-warping AI algorithm successfully distinguished skill levels in table tennis forehand strokes between beginner and intermediate players (Cohen's d=0.86), with DTW values correlating with coach evaluations of stroke effectiveness.

data.title: Altered gait biomechanics after peroneus longus tendon harvest for anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction
data.sub_theme: ACL reconstruction, graft harvest, gait biomechanics, rehabilitation
data.summary: Peroneus longus tendon harvest for ACL reconstruction resulted in subtle gait alterations including prolonged single-leg support time despite overall functional improvements, suggesting need for targeted ankle rehabilitation in athletes.

data.title: The Feasibility and Preliminary Effectiveness of a 6-Week Independent Cadence Retraining Program on Parous Runners With Stress Urinary Incontinence
data.journal: Journal of Women s & Pelvic Health Physical Therapy
data.sub_theme: stress urinary incontinence, cadence retraining, running biomechanics
data.summary: Six-week cadence retraining program significantly increased running cadence and decreased vertical oscillation in parous female runners with stress urinary incontinence, with concomitant improvements in incontinence symptoms.

data.title: From amenorrhea to pregnancy: spontaneous recovery of the female athlete triad during the COVID-19 pandemic
data.sub_theme: relative energy deficiency, female athlete triad, menstrual dysfunction, bone health
data.summary: Case report of a professional triathlete with hypothalamic amenorrhea due to relative energy deficiency showing spontaneous remission of female athlete triad and restoration of menstrual function following pandemic-induced reduction in training and improved dietary intake.

data.title: Differences in subcutaneous fat composition and skeletal muscle mass between female and male college students
data.sub_theme: body composition, sex differences, bioelectrical impedance
data.summary: Bioelectrical impedance analysis of college students (non-athletes) revealed sex differences in body composition with females showing greater subcutaneous fat and lower skeletal muscle mass than males, influenced by hormonal and metabolic factors.

data.title: The Role of Cannabidiol in Sport: Mechanistic Insights, Ergogenic Potential, and Regulatory Implications
data.sub_theme: cannabidiol, CBD supplementation, anti-doping, ergogenic effects
data.summary: Comprehensive investigation of cannabidiol in sport found that broad-spectrum CBD supplementation did not enhance cycling performance and posed significant anti-doping risk by introducing prohibited cannabinoids in urine, especially when combined with moderate-intensity exercise.

data.title: The Relationship Between Hand Dominance and ACL Tears in Competitive Volleyball Athletes
data.sub_theme: ACL tears, hand dominance, laterality, biomechanical risk factors
data.summary: Cross-sectional study of 149 competitive volleyball players revealed significant association between hand dominance and ACL tear laterality, with right-handed players predominantly tearing their left ACL (81.62%) and left-handed players their right ACL (84.62%).

data.title: Psychological skills training as a strategy to improve mental health and reduce perceived stress in university athletes
data.sub_theme: psychological skills training, stress reduction
data.summary: A one-month psychological skills training program significantly reduced perceived stress in university athletes (mean PSS-10 decreased from 24.14 to 16.81, d=1.30), with high-stress athletes dropping from 38% to 4.8%.

data.title: Analysis of sports injuries in the implementation of the new 2023 regulations for the sport of Pencak Silat in the 17-35 age category
data.sub_theme: injury incidence, Pencak Silat, gender differences
data.summary: In 30 competitive Pencak Silat athletes, sprains (22%) and bruises (19.5%) were most common injuries with lower extremities most affected; 64% reported that 2023 rule changes increased injury risk.

data.title: Long-term Outcomes After Hip Arthroscopy for Femoroacetabular Impingement Syndrome in Master Athletes: A Propensity-Matched Study With Mean 10-Year Follow-up
data.journal: The American Journal of Sports Medicine
data.sub_theme: hip arthroscopy outcomes, femoroacetabular impingement, master athletes
data.summary: Master athletes (≥35 years, weekly sports participation) showed superior long-term patient-reported outcomes and reoperation-free survivorship at 10-year follow-up after hip arthroscopy for femoroacetabular impingement compared to propensity-matched non-athletic controls.

data.title: A243: The Relationship Among Sport Confidence, Failure Coping, and Athletic Motivation of Students in Physical Education
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: sport confidence, failure coping, athletic motivation
data.summary: In 897 physical education students, trait and state sport confidence were positively correlated (r=0.409), failure coping dimensions positively intercorrelated (r=0.255-0.401), and participation and avoidance motivation tendencies positively related (r=0.329).

data.title: Physical Therapy Patient-Reported Outcome Measures for the Female Athlete With Urinary Incontinence: A Scoping Review
data.journal: Journal of Women s & Pelvic Health Physical Therapy
data.sub_theme: urinary incontinence, female athletes, patient-reported outcome measures
data.summary: A scoping review of 35 publications found zero psychometrically validated patient-reported outcome measures specifically for female athletes with urinary incontinence, indicating a significant gap in assessment tools for this population.

data.title: Identifying individual playing roles in professional and semi-professional male and female basketball players: a systematic review
data.sub_theme: individual playing roles, position classification, game-related statistics
data.summary: A systematic review of 12 studies on basketball playing roles identified seven recurrent individual playing roles but found methodological heterogeneity, highlighting the need for standardized frameworks to identify roles using game-related statistics.

data.title: Women's participation in sport and physical activity in Saudi Arabia: an intersectional study
data.sub_theme: women's participation in sport and physical activity
data.summary: Intersectional analysis of women's participation in sport and physical activity in Saudi Arabia, examining socio-cultural barriers and opportunities.

data.title: Women's participation in sport and physical activity in Saudi Arabia: an intersectional study
data.sub_theme: women's participation in sport and physical activity
data.summary: Intersectional analysis of women's participation in sport and physical activity in Saudi Arabia, examining socio-cultural barriers and opportunities.

data.title: Análisis del lenguaje inclusivo en la prensa deportiva en España desde una óptica de género: los Juegos Olímpicos de París
data.sub_theme: media coverage and inclusive language in sports journalism
data.summary: Mixed-methods analysis of 76 Spanish sports newspaper front pages during Paris 2024 Olympics reveals stereotypical language and underrepresentation of female athletes compared to male counterparts.

data.title: Synergistic interaction of phosphorous-doped BiOI with functionalized carbon nanofibers for efficient electrochemical sensing of dimetridazole
data.summary: Materials science study on phosphorus-doped bismuth oxyiodide nanofiber composites for electrochemical sensing of dimetridazole; unrelated to sports.

data.summary: Materials science study on silver-copper ferrite nanocomposites for electrochemical ascorbic acid detection; unrelated to sports.

data.title: Doping Detection through Haematological Parameters and D-dimer Levels amongst Athletes and Sports Administrators in Ibadan, Southwestern Nigeria
data.sub_theme: haematological biomarkers for doping detection
data.summary: Cross-sectional descriptive study measuring complete blood count and D-dimer parameters in 144 Nigerian athletes using Athlete Biological Passport methods found no doping indicators but elevated D-dimer levels suggesting thrombotic status.

data.summary: Chemistry study on nitrogen-doped carbon dots-europium fluorescence probe for pyrophosphate and alkaline phosphatase detection in water and serum samples; unrelated to sports.

data.summary: Materials science study on Au:Er composite thin films for metallic magnetic calorimetry in gamma-ray detection; not related to sports.

data.title: Further Insights Into the Metabolism of LGD-4033 in Human Urine. Part 2. A New Minor Metabolite With Antagonistic Activity on the Androgen Receptor Can Indicate Recent Substance Intake
data.summary: Pharmaceutical/doping analysis study investigating LGD-4033 metabolites in human urine for anti-doping control; not a sports performance or athlete health study per se.

data.sub_theme: anti-doping detection, androstenedione metabolites
data.summary: Computer-aided drug design using molecular docking simulations identifies long-acting androstenedione metabolites to extend detection windows in anti-doping tests across sports.

data.summary: Materials science study on In-doped ZnO nanofibers for bacterial detection; not related to sports.

data.title: S-doped Fe single atoms as efficient peroxidase-like nanozymes for colorimetric detection of oxytetracycline
data.summary: Chemistry study on S-doped Fe nanozymes for oxytetracycline detection; not related to sports.

data.summary: Materials science/engineering study on piezoresistive cantilever MEMS sensors for force measurement; not related to sports.

data.summary: Patent disclosure on synthesis and applications of Au@C60 fullerene endohedral compounds for medical imaging and sensing; not related to sports.

data.summary: Chemistry study on cobalt-doped carbon dot nanozymes for nitrite ion detection and antibacterial activity; not related to sports.

data.summary: Environmental chemistry study on photocatalyst synthesis for degradation of polychlorinated biphenyls and dyes in water; not related to sports.

data.summary: Development of a quartz crystal microbalance sensor using graphitic carbon nitride and copper metal-organic frameworks for pesticide detection—not related to sports.

data.summary: Development of copper-doped carbon nanodot nanocomposites for photocatalytic degradation of methyl orange dye in wastewater treatment—not related to sports.

data.summary: Development of an electrochemical immunosensor using MXene and cerium-doped covalent organic framework for ultrasensitive detection of methyl parathion pesticide—not related to sports.

data.sub_theme: biosensor technology
data.summary: A germanium-doped photonic crystal fiber biosensor using surface plasmon resonance achieves high sensitivity for distinguishing normal, tumor-derived, and pro-metastatic exosomes with detection accuracies in the 10^-5 to 10^-6 RIU range.

data.title: Dual-mode fluorometric and colorimetric sensors based on carbon quantum dots-doped MIL-53(Fe) encapsulated in SiO2 shells for fluoride detection
data.sub_theme: fluoride detection sensor
data.summary: Carbon quantum dots doped in MIL-53(Fe) and encapsulated in SiO2 shells create a dual-mode fluorometric and colorimetric sensor for environmental fluoride detection.

data.title: N-doped carbon quantum dots for the detection of 4-nitrophenol, antioxidant activity, and synthesis of Fe <sub>3</sub> O <sub>4</sub> CuO@CQD as a catalyst for the reduction of 4-nitroaniline
data.sub_theme: nanomaterial synthesis and catalysis
data.summary: Nitrogen-doped carbon quantum dots synthesized from turmeric and L-arginine detect 4-nitrophenol and serve as catalysts for 4-nitroaniline reduction via an environmentally friendly hydrothermal process.

data.title: A Highly Sensitive and Selective Sb‐Doped <scp> MoS <sub>2</sub> </scp> Monolayer in Detecting Toxic Gases: Insight From <scp>DFT</scp> and <scp>NEGF</scp>
data.sub_theme: toxic gas detection sensor
data.summary: DFT and NEGF computational analysis of Sb-doped MoS2 monolayer shows high sensitivity for selective detection of toxic gases, with CO exhibiting 68.32% sensitivity at 1.7 V bias.

data.title: Bifunctional Nitrogen‐Doped Yellow‐Green Carbon Dots: Integrated Fluorescent Probe for Sensitive Antibiotic Detection and Oxygen “Breathing Color” Tracking
data.sub_theme: antibiotic detection and food safety
data.summary: Bifunctional nitrogen-doped yellow-green carbon dots detect the antibiotic nitrofurantoin with 2.1 μM detection limit and enable oxygen-responsive color shifts for food freshness monitoring.

data.sub_theme: nanozyme catalysis for silver detection
data.summary: Boron heteroatom-doped carbon dots create a nanozyme with peroxidase-like activity enabling colorimetric detection of silver(I) with 0.23 μM limit of detection and smartphone-based onsite monitoring.

data.summary: Defensive patent publication disclosing synthesis, purification, characterization, and applications of Pt@C60 endohedral metallofullerenes in medical imaging, antioxidants, and electronics.

data.summary: DFT computational investigation shows that vanadium-doped gallium nitride nanotubes exhibit superior adsorption energy and shortest adsorption distance for detecting heptanal, a breast cancer biomarker.

data.summary: CuO-nitrogen-doped carbon dot nanozymes enable colorimetric detection of ascorbic acid in strawberries with 0.02 mg/L detection limit and recovery rates of 96.7–99.9%.

data.sub_theme: vision chip technology
data.summary: Systematic review of high-speed vision chips for edge computing, analyzing CMOS image sensors, dynamic vision sensors, and single-photon detectors with integrated sensing-computation co-processing paradigms.

data.summary: Descriptive analysis of passing and shooting accuracy in 20 handball athletes from Makassar City showing average passing accuracy of 78.5% and shooting accuracy of 69.2%, with recommendations for pressure training integration.

data.summary: A laboratory study using virtual reality and two-way ANOVA showed that university basketball players demonstrated significantly greater accuracy and consistency on a perceptual decision-making task compared to non-athletes, with moderate associations to assists and box creation scores.

data.title: A149: Research on the Application of Artificial Intelligence in Football

data.summary: A narrative review and interview-based study examining artificial intelligence applications in football identifies advances in data collection types, analytical capacity, real-time processing, and accuracy, demonstrating improvements in injury prevention, training planning, and performance analysis.

data.title: Talent, Capital, and the FIFA World Cup: How Participation Affects Football Players’ Market Value
data.sub_theme: World Cup participation impact on market value
data.summary: Hierarchical linear modeling of 675 European league players shows FIFA World Cup participation does not automatically increase market values; individual performance, social media fandom, and league affiliation drive value changes more than team success.

data.title: Single- and Double-Row Arthroscopic Bony Bankart Repair
data.sub_theme: shoulder surgery technique
data.summary: Video technique describing arthroscopic single- and double-row repair procedures for bony Bankart lesions in anterior shoulder instability; primarily a surgical methods paper with no sports-specific focus.

data.title: Using Cervical Spine Proprioception and Vestibular/Oculomotor Assessments to Identify Return-to-Play Clearance Prognosis After Adolescent Concussion
data.sub_theme: concussion return-to-play clearance prediction
data.summary: Prospective cohort study of 68 adolescents with concussion found cervical spine proprioception and vestibular/oculomotor assessments were not predictive of return-to-play clearance time in multivariable analysis.

data.title: The impact of therapeutic exercises and ultrasound therapy on the rehabilitation of partially injured hamstring muscles in elite football players: a randomized controlled trial
data.sub_theme: hamstring strain rehabilitation with ultrasound
data.summary: Randomized controlled trial of 150 elite football players found therapeutic ultrasound combined with exercise achieved significantly faster hamstring recovery (18.3 vs 21.7 days), greater pain reduction, and higher strength gains than exercise alone.

data.title: P-1874. Measuring the Clinical Impact of a Novel Infectious Disease Step-Down Service
data.sub_theme: infectious disease clinical service outcomes
data.summary: Retrospective review of 347 hospital patients under an infectious disease step-down service examining antimicrobial regimen changes and re-consultation rates; no sports-related content.

data.title: Neuromuscular Adaptations of the Rotator Cuff and Scapular Stabilizers Following TheraBand-Based Throwing Training in Symptomatic Volleyball Players with Shoulder Internal Rotation Deficit: A Randomized Controlled Trial

data.summary: Randomized controlled trial of 64 male collegiate volleyball players with GIRD found 12-week progressive TheraBand throwing training produced 107-122% increases in rotator cuff and scapular stabilizer EMG activation with improved stability indices and pain reduction.

data.title: Comparative Effects of Progressive TheraBand Throwing Load Versus Conventional Stretching on Posterior Shoulder Tightness, Internal Rotation Deficit, and Tendon Load Tolerance in Volleyball Players: A Randomized Controlled Trial
data.journal: Zenodo (CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research)

data.summary: Randomized controlled trial of 68 male collegiate volleyball players found progressive TheraBand throwing load superior to stretching for GIRD correction (79% vs 22% cross-body adduction ROM improvement) and reducing 12-month recurrent shoulder pain incidence.

data.sub_theme: throwing biomechanics and upper extremity injuries in baseball and football
data.summary: Narrative review comparing throwing biomechanics between baseball pitchers and football quarterbacks found pitchers sustain higher rates of both elbow and shoulder injuries, with distinct biomechanical differences affecting injury prevalence and treatment approaches.

data.title: The Magical Power of Music: The Chinese Lute and the Music of Spheres as Symbols of Cosmic Harmony

data.summary: Philosophical and historical analysis of the Chinese lute's role in self-cultivation and cosmic harmony, drawing parallels with Greek music of the spheres; entirely non-sports related.

data.summary: Panel data regression analysis of 24 Indonesian non-cyclical consumer family firms examining effects of family ownership, involvement, and founder generation on dividend policy; no sports-related content.

data.title: Silent or Salient? Ability Heterogeneity in Tournaments
data.sub_theme: tournament incentive design, relative performance information
data.summary: Experimental study shows that relative performance information (RPI) is more effective in tournament competitions when employee abilities are homogeneous and ability differences are salient, with differential effects on high and low performers.

data.title: Additional file 3 of Mechanisms of ulnar collateral ligament injury in baseball: criteria and rationale for return to play — a systematic review
data.sub_theme: ulnar collateral ligament injury, return-to-play criteria
data.summary: Supplementary material for a systematic review of mechanisms of ulnar collateral ligament injury in baseball and return-to-play criteria.

data.title: Additional file 1 of Mechanisms of ulnar collateral ligament injury in baseball: criteria and rationale for return to play — a systematic review
data.sub_theme: ulnar collateral ligament injury, return-to-play criteria
data.summary: Supplementary material for a systematic review of mechanisms of ulnar collateral ligament injury in baseball and return-to-play criteria.

data.title: The impact of therapeutic exercises and ultrasound therapy on the rehabilitation of partially injured hamstring muscles in elite football players: a randomized controlled trial
data.sub_theme: hamstring injury rehabilitation, ultrasound therapy, return-to-play
data.summary: Randomized controlled trial in 150 elite male football players shows that combining therapeutic ultrasound with exercises significantly reduces hamstring recovery time (18.3 vs 21.7 days), improves pain reduction, and enhances muscle strength compared to exercise alone.

data.title: Technology Focus: Well Integrity (January 2026)
data.sub_theme: well integrity, blowout prevention, CO2 storage
data.summary: Technology review focused on well integrity, blowout-preventer inspection using computer vision, and P&A well modeling for CO2 storage in petroleum industry.

data.title: USA: Impact of Customs Duties on Domestic Manufacturing Capacity
data.sub_theme: tariff policy, international trade, manufacturing
data.summary: Economic analysis of US tariff policy effects on domestic manufacturing capacity during 2018-2020 trade war with China, showing low efficiency of tariffs alone for industrial development.

data.title: Artificial Intelligence Applied to Human Activity Recognition in Sports and Exercise: A Bibliometrics and Visual Analysis
data.sub_theme: human activity recognition, artificial intelligence, deep learning, wearable sensors
data.summary: Bibliometric and visualization analysis of 432 articles (2001–2024) on AI application to human activity recognition in sports and exercise, identifying deep learning as dominant technique achieving >90% accuracy with future needs in real-time performance and complex scenarios.

data.title: Ultra-High Field Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Characterisation of the Functional Anatomy and 3D Structural Arrangement of Equine Superficial Digital Flexor Tendons
data.sub_theme: tendon structure and injury characterization in horses
data.summary: Ultra-high field MRI and deep learning (3D U-Net) were used to characterize the three-dimensional structural arrangement and biomechanical properties of equine superficial digital flexor tendons, identifying age-related changes and tendinopathy markers.

data.title: A Machine Learning Model for Analysis and Prediction of Football Match Outcomes in the English Premier League
data.journal: International Journal of Research and Innovation in Applied Science
data.sub_theme: match outcome prediction in English Premier League
data.summary: An ensemble machine learning model combining Random Forest, XGBoost, and LightGBoost achieved 87.14% accuracy and 99.00% ROC-AUC in predicting English Premier League match outcomes using historical match data.

data.title: RECYCLING AND REUSE OF MATERIALS IN METALLURGICAL PROCESSES
data.journal: Harvard International Journal of Engineering Research and Technology
data.sub_theme: digital technologies in metallurgical recycling processes
data.summary: A review examined the role of AI, IoT, big data analytics, and digital twins in improving metal recovery efficiency, material traceability, and sustainability in ferrous and non-ferrous metallurgical recycling systems.

data.title: A063: Research on the Load Characteristics of Female College Volleyball Players in Consecutive Matches
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: match load monitoring, fatigue accumulation
data.summary: Female college volleyball players in consecutive matches showed total movement load of 816.8 ± 124.6 with initial decrease then increase across matches, with detailed speed zone and physiological metrics tracked via IMU and heart rate monitors.

data.title: A171: An Applied Study of Smart Sports to Enable Youth Soccer Training
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: youth training technology, smart sports
data.summary: Smart sports technology with GPS tracking, heart rate monitors, and AI-powered feedback improved technical and tactical performance in youth soccer players (ages 12-16) over 8 weeks of training.

data.title: An investigation into performance monitoring in women’s elite rugby sevens, with consideration towards the Countermovement Jump (CMJ) Test and the GPS-Derived Metric High Metabolic Load Distance (HMLD)
data.sub_theme: countermovement jump, GPS metrics, HMLD
data.summary: Elite female rugby sevens players showed significant positional differences in CMJ performance and High Metabolic Load Distance, with HMLD correlating strongly with total distance (r=0.82) rather than intensity.

data.title: An Evaluation of the Nutritional Practices and Energy Requirements of Elite Female Soccer Players: A Mixed Methods Investigation
data.sub_theme: energy requirements, female athlete triad, relative energy deficiency
data.summary: Mixed methods investigation of elite female soccer players revealed underrecognized nutrition gaps and chronic low energy availability through interviews with 47 stakeholders and quantitative energy assessment.

data.title: Key performance indicators in elite male blind and partially sighted football
data.sub_theme: key performance indicators, vision impairment, blind football
data.summary: Key performance indicators for male blind and partially sighted football identified passing efficiency, offensive zone entries, and possession as predictors of match outcomes via notational analysis of 54 matches.

data.title: Epidemiology, Performance, and Return to Sport After Rib Fracture in Professional Baseball Players
data.sub_theme: rib fractures, return-to-sport, epidemiology
data.summary: Professional baseball players with rib stress fractures missed significantly more time (98.13 days) than those with traumatic fractures (47.44 days), with pitchers and stress injuries showing worse return-to-sport outcomes.

data.title: Classifying player profiles in elite women’s football: A K-means clustering analysis of physical and technical data from the 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup
data.sub_theme: player clustering, technical and physical profiling
data.summary: K-means clustering of tracking and technical event data from 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup identified 18 distinct player clusters reflecting offensive behaviors, with 34.5% showing stable specialization and 65.5% displaying hybrid profiles.

data.title: Perceptions of Biomechanical Devices in Collegiate Baseball Pitchers and Training Staff: A Qualitative Study
data.sub_theme: biomechanical devices, wearable technology implementation
data.summary: Qualitative study of collegiate baseball pitchers and staff identified facilitators (individualized data, self-awareness, injury prevention) and barriers (data interpretation, systemization) for adopting novel biomechanical pitching sleeves and force plates.

data.title: A251: Artificial Intelligence Facilitates Intelligent Rehabilitation-Performance Training Integration Following Sports Injuries
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: AI-driven rehabilitation-performance training integration
data.summary: Literature review examines artificial intelligence applications in post-injury rehabilitation assessment and rehabilitation-to-performance training transitions across sports.

data.title: School‑Based Swimming Education in Primary Children: A Systematic Review of Teaching Approaches, Aquatic Competence, and Water Safety Outcomes
data.sub_theme: school-based swimming education and water safety
data.summary: Systematic review of school-based swimming education in primary children (6-12 years) identifies programme configurations that effectively improve aquatic competence, water safety knowledge, and psychological outcomes using Block's 5C framework.

data.title: Impact of Individual-Specific Strength Exercises on Knee Muscle Strength and Speed Performance in Speed Skaters: A Randomised Control Trial
data.sub_theme: strength training, knee muscle development
data.summary: Individual-specific knee strengthening exercises significantly improved knee flexor/extensor strength and inline skating speed in young speed skaters (aged 8-14) over 8 weeks compared to controls.

data.title: Fluorescent biosensor based cerium-doped carbon quantum dots for albumin detection
data.summary: Development of a cerium-doped carbon quantum dot fluorescent biosensor for rapid detection of bovine serum albumin with high selectivity and low detection limit.

data.title: KBO Pitching ML Classification - Replication Data
data.sub_theme: playoff advancement prediction from pitching metrics
data.summary: Machine learning classification of Korean Professional Baseball team playoff advancement using pitching performance metrics (2015-2024 dataset).

data.title: Data analytics practices and reporting strategies in senior football: insights into athlete health and performance from over 200 practitioners worldwide
data.journal: University of Limerick Institutional Repository (University of Limerick)
data.sub_theme: data analytics practices, performance monitoring
data.summary: A survey of 206 football practitioners across six FIFA confederations revealed heterogeneous data analytics practices, with exploratory data analysis being most common (90%) and limited adoption of advanced modelling and forecasting techniques (54%).

data.title: Attitudes towards chiropractic: an analysis of written comments from a survey of Canadian sport and exercise medicine physicians
data.sub_theme: Physician attitudes towards chiropractic in sports medicine
data.summary: Qualitative analysis of 27 Canadian sport and exercise medicine physicians' written survey comments revealing six themes about chiropractic, including concerns about variability, training, and ethical issues.

data.title: A107: Multidimensional Influencing Factors and Psychosocial Mechanisms of Eating Disorders in Female Athletes
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: Eating disorders in female athletes
data.summary: Systematic review of 30 studies synthesizing multidimensional risk factors for eating disorders in female athletes across five dimensions (training environment, dietary behavior, body image, psychosocial mechanisms, media exposure), with higher risk in lean sports.

data.title: Self-Management, Fear of Movement, and Pain in Working Adults with Low Back Pain: A Qualitative Longitudinal Study
data.sub_theme: Self-management in low back pain during physical therapy
data.summary: Qualitative longitudinal study of 15 working adults with low back pain identifying two client types (pilot vs. passenger) and three main categories of pain experience and self-management over 12-month follow-up.

data.title: Acupressure for Sleep, Mental Health, and Quality of Life in Hemodialysis Patients: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
data.sub_theme: Acupressure for sleep and mental health in hemodialysis patients
data.summary: Systematic review and meta-analysis evaluating acupressure efficacy for improving sleep quality, mental health, and quality of life in hemodialysis patients.

data.title: Sex Differences in Resistance Training Participation and Beliefs Among Adolescent Athletes: An Exploratory Cross-Sectional Study
data.sub_theme: Sex differences in resistance training participation among adolescent athletes
data.summary: Cross-sectional survey of 108 adolescent athletes (62 female, 46 male) finding no significant sex differences in RT frequency but males reporting greater barbell/machine use and enjoyment, with females starting RT younger.

data.title: The Inflammatory Roles of n-3 and n-6 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids in COPD: Clinical Implications and Underlying Mechanisms
data.sub_theme: COPD inflammation, PUFA mechanisms
data.summary: Narrative review of polyunsaturated fatty acids in COPD management reveals limited and inconsistent evidence for n-3 PUFAs, recommending rigorous future clinical trials to establish biological and clinical efficacy.

data.title: Dietary Inflammatory Potential and its Relationship with Symptoms, Health-Related Quality of Life and Wellbeing in Adults with Knee Osteoarthritis
data.sub_theme: dietary inflammatory potential, knee osteoarthritis
data.summary: PhD thesis examining relationship between dietary inflammatory potential and symptoms, quality of life, and wellbeing in adults with knee osteoarthritis in a sports medicine context.

data.title: Relative energy deficiency in sport (REDs) in women’s soccer: a scoping review mapped to the REDs health and performance models
data.sub_theme: relative energy deficiency in sport, low energy availability
data.summary: Scoping review mapping relative energy deficiency in sport (REDs) and low energy availability in women's soccer, identifying significant research gaps in nutrition, illness, and integrated performance analysis.

data.title: Dietary Inflammatory Potential and its Relationship with Symptoms, Health-Related Quality of Life and Wellbeing in Adults with Knee Osteoarthritis
data.sub_theme: dietary inflammatory potential, knee osteoarthritis
data.summary: PhD thesis examining relationship between dietary inflammatory potential and symptoms, quality of life, and wellbeing in adults with knee osteoarthritis in a sports medicine context.

data.title: Playing Through Pain: Associations Between Pain Intensity, Pain Interference, and Mental Health Outcomes in Collegiate Athletes
data.sub_theme: pain, depression, anxiety in collegiate athletes
data.summary: Structural equation modeling of 3,552 collegiate athletes demonstrates pain intensity predicts pain interference, which significantly predicts depression and anxiety, with differences across contact sport and gender.

data.title: Cognitive Neuroscience in Alpine Skiing: Introducing Computational Sports Medicine for Performance Optimization
data.journal: Scandinavian Journal of Medicine and Science in Sports
data.sub_theme: cognitive neuroscience and working memory in alpine skiing
data.summary: This narrative review proposes Computational Sports Medicine, integrating cognitive neuroscience with physiological and biomechanical measures in alpine skiing, emphasizing working memory updating and offering frameworks for performance optimization, injury prevention, and return-to-play decisions.

data.title: Revisión sistemática de las intervenciones cognitivo–conductuales basadas en mindfulness en la mejora del rendimiento deportivo en jóvenes atletas
data.sub_theme: mindfulness-based cognitive-behavioral interventions in youth athletes
data.summary: A systematic review of 20 studies (2021–2025) found that mindfulness-based cognitive-behavioral interventions significantly improved athletic performance in young athletes, particularly by reducing competitive anxiety, enhancing attention, and promoting flow state through psychological flexibility mechanisms.

data.title: A065: Effect of Mental Fatigue on Lower Limb Biomechanics and ACL Injury Risk in Basketball Players
data.journal: International Journal of Physical Activity and Health
data.sub_theme: mental fatigue and ACL injury risk in basketball
data.summary: A controlled study of 38 basketball players using motion capture and EMG found that mental fatigue induced by cognitive tasks significantly decreased knee flexion angle, internal rotation, and muscle activation, increasing potential ACL injury risk during stop-jump actions.

data.title: Using Image Method to Evaluate the Unidirectional Water-Penetration Performance of Fabrics
data.sub_theme: fabric water-penetration performance evaluation
data.summary: This materials science paper develops an image-based system to evaluate water-penetration performance of athletic apparel fabrics using high-speed imaging and machine learning; it is about textile engineering, not sports performance or athlete health.

data.title: Sparta Science Force Plate Assessment of Recovery Following Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction
data.sub_theme: ACL reconstruction return-to-sport assessment, force plate reliability
data.summary: Force plate metrics showed moderate to excellent reliability for assessing return-to-sport readiness in ACL reconstruction patients at 9 months postoperatively, with kinetic profiles (load, explode, drive) differentiating from healthy population norms.

data.title: Running Practices in the Light of Virtue Ethics (review of S. Little's book "Control Running: Why Good People Become Better Runners")
data.sub_theme: virtue ethics, moral character development in endurance running
data.summary: Book review explores how virtue ethics and character development through running practice contribute to athlete development, identifying vicious traits (pride, envy) and virtues (generosity, perseverance) relevant to distance running performance.

data.title: Factors Affecting Return to Play in Athletes With Foot and Ankle Injuries.
data.sub_theme: foot and ankle injuries, return-to-play psychology and physiology
data.summary: Review identifies multifaceted factors affecting return-to-play in foot and ankle injuries, emphasizing physiologic healing, psychological readiness, and interdisciplinary team approaches involving surgeons, therapists, and trainers.

data.title: From injury to comeback: A systematic review of machine learning models predicting return to sport in athletes
data.sub_theme: machine learning prediction of return-to-sport, injury-specific RTS models
data.summary: Systematic review of 11 studies found Random Forest was the most effective machine learning algorithm for predicting return-to-sport decisions, particularly for knee injuries, with AUCs exceeding 0.9, but identified substantial heterogeneity limiting clinical translation.

data.title: Injury to Insight: Exploring the Influence of Media on ACL Rehabilitation Experiences of Female Soccer Players
data.sub_theme: ACL injury rehabilitation, media influence on psychological recovery in women's soccer
data.summary: Qualitative study of female soccer players found media narratives significantly influence psychological rehabilitation experiences following ACL reconstruction, with implications for coaching and sports psychology support.

data.title: Early Return to Competitive Sport Following a Surgically Managed Mandibular Fracture: A Multimodal Ultrasound-Guided Rehabilitation Case Report
data.sub_theme: mandibular fracture rehabilitation, return-to-sport case study
data.summary: Multimodal ultrasound-guided rehabilitation of elite judoka with mandibular fracture achieved competitive return within 8 weeks using dry needling, TMJ manual therapy, and digital home program, demonstrating accelerated functional recovery.

data.title: Cervical Radiculopathy and Neuromusculoskeletal Mimics in the Athlete
data.sub_theme: cervical radiculopathy diagnosis, differential diagnosis in athletes
data.summary: Review article addresses diagnostic differentiation of cervical radiculopathy from musculoskeletal and neurogenic mimics in athletes, emphasizing clinical examination over imaging for timely diagnosis and management.

data.title: Synergistic Effects of an 8-Week Resistance Training Program and Creatine Supplementation on Hormonal, Metabolic, Inflammatory, and Body Composition Markers in 30- to 45-Year-Old Male Athletes: Modulation by ACTN3 (R577X)
data.sub_theme: creatine supplementation, resistance training, hormonal and metabolic effects, ACTN3 genotype moderation
data.summary: Combined 8-week resistance training and creatine supplementation significantly increased lean body mass and improved insulin sensitivity in 30–45-year-old male athletes, with ACTN3 genotype as a potential moderator of metabolic response.

data.title: Efectos del Modelo Ludotécnico sobre la intención de práctica y el rendimiento en la iniciación al atletismo
data.journal: Sportis Scientific Journal of School Sport Physical Education and Psychomotricity
data.sub_theme: ludotechnical model pedagogy, youth athletics motivation and performance
data.summary: Controlled study of 142 youth athletes (8–13 years) found the Ludotechnical Model significantly increased self-determination motivation (6.74 to 8.34, p=.04) and improved physical performance in athletics initiation compared to traditional methods.

data.title: Effects of Unstable versus Stable Resistance Training on Trunk Strength and Endurance in Healthy Populations: A Meta-Analysis
data.journal: Translational Journal of the American College of Sports Medicine
data.sub_theme: unstable resistance training, trunk strength and endurance, core stability
data.summary: Meta-analysis of 17 studies (n=836) found unstable resistance training significantly improved dynamic trunk endurance (g=0.45) over stable training but provided no additional benefit for trunk strength in healthy populations.
